description: I came here on a slow easy going Tuesday. I came here for the lunch special. Thai bbq pork. The pork was nice and tender. Not much far. It was marianted good. It wasn't too salty. I usually get the chicken curry special. But I opted for something else today.
author: Selby C.

description:
My fiancé and I were starving but still had to run some errands -- grocery shopping -- so we tried to find a convenient location where we could do both and ended up at Lakeshore Plaza, where we thought we'd try some noodles at The Noodle House and grocery shop at Lucky's.

I got the Guay Tiew Lord. I ordered this because it's so rare that Thai restaurants in the states have this -- I can only really get it when my mom makes it or when I go back to Thailand -- and just seeing the name on the menu gave me a hankering for it. But I knew from the second our waiter put it in front of me that I'd be severely disappointed -- and I was not wrong. The noodles had been carelessly and thoughtlessly boiled. The seafood was done all wrong -- the imitation crab (first of all, what place does this have in Guay Tiew Lord and who the heck thought it was smart to put it in here???) and calamari tasted freezer burned, and the shrimp was overcooked and shriveled up. The flavor was extremely salty and one dimensional. But. Because I was REALLY hungry -- and because I'm frugal and won't ever throw away food no matter how sucky it is -- I ate as much as I could -- about 1/3 of the dish -- before I asked for a box to take it home, where I will very begrudgingly force myself to finish it.

My fiancé got the Pad Kee Mao, which is one of his favs at Thai places. He said it was "...edible, not great but not horrible."

One star for okay service and one star for pretty legit Thai iced coffee but honesty, don't come here. If you're craving pan-fried noodles like we were, you'd be so much better off at that Chinese counter food place tucked inside Lucky's. If you're craving a slightly classier sit-down Asian place, go to the sushi place across the plaza! Go anywhere but here.
author: Virulpat W.

description:
This use to be my go to Thai spot for quite awhile when it was called the King of Thai. Seems they have new ownership and the changes they've made aren't for the better. Before the ambience was nice for dining in but now it seems more appropriate for take out. 

Came here on a week night with a friend and ordered the Chicken Panang curry and pad see ew. The food it self is not bad and the flavors are good. Portions are moderate. Though, service here is not very attentive and ambiance isn't very inviting. Not sure if I would dine in again, but would definitely order take from here.
author: Lauren P.

description: The worst Thai place I have ever been. The food is horrible, 1 star for a good staff. I will never ever come back.
author: Sher D.

description:
This place is not what it used to be. I came here a lot during my hs days. You can really tell that it is under new management. 

Cons: 
Portion sizes
My bf ordered the pad Thai and I ordered the pad see ew. 25% size decrease. Sad

Quality of food
My bf and I ordered a pad see ew and pad Thai with shrimp. Pad see ew was perfectly fine but when I tried the pad Thai, this sour taste surrounded my taste buds. The shrimp smelled fishy and tasted like it went bad. I know pad Thai contains lemons, but this sour taste was definitely not from the lemons. Gross 

Ambience 
On a sunny Sunday afternoon, the lights are on full blast. Very uncomfortable and almost blinding if stare for too long. The radio is mediocre, barely any sound. No body in the restaurant talks because you can hear conversations easily. Awkward silence..... 

Cash only 
There is no sign that it is cash only. This is sad bc at the end of the meal, I had to take a trip next door to luckys to pull cash from the ATM due to this inconvenience. 

The restaurant really went down hill after the new management came in. I will not be returning.
author: AJ C.

description:
Wow, this place has CHANGED and is now unrecognizable.  It used to be a nice clean pleasant restaurant with good size tasty thai dishes. However, it's recently become a more fast food joint type feel. You need to order at the counter and pay first now, rather than sitting down and the waiter coming to you. There are less tables to dine in and they have patio chairs for you to sit on. It's self serve grab your own water and napkins at the station.... heck, you might as well take your food to go (save yourself on the tip). Even if you tell them you are eating there, the dishes still come in a plastic container.

Food portions are much smaller, but the price hasn't changed or been reduced. The quality has gone down slightly and the dishes dont quite taste the same. Not much service. They also cut back their hours and close sooner now. 

I am not going to say eating there is horrible or the food is inedible. It's just that this place has dropped off in standards and the level where it used to be. There are a lot of other better thai restaurants in the city for the same price.
author: Eric M.

description:
This use to be King of Thai Noodles. Now it's just "The Noodle House". 

To keep it short, DON'T waste your money here. Service is poor, portions are small, and you don't even get proper utensils.

I came in and ordered at the counter, like those Indian joints. OK fine. Saves me time to ask for the check later. I asked for water and they just gave me two paper cups.

We had a Tom Yum Soup and a Chicken with Basil and rice. Soup came in a plastic bowl with a small plastic spoon that can barely scoop any soup. Not even a soup spoon!? The rice came in a plastic to go container and the bottom was pressed upward to make it look fuller! Are you kidding me? 

You even have to go get your own sauces as they are not kept at the tables any more!

For my $10.99 bowl of Tom Yum soup, I had 1 corner cut of tomato! Barely any chicken, mostly mushrooms and the hard bamboo stuff. I had to just chug down the soup as that little spoon isn't going to cut it.

They'll be closed out by the end of the year. By next summer tops! The writings on the wall.
author: Johnny D.

description:
Once you walk in, you go to the counter and place your order. 
Even for eat-in orders, everything comes in a to-go box. They had cups for water, but my cup was dirty, I'll pass..
Ordered pad see ew with seafood. Large portion of noodles, the seafood likely came from a seafood mix bag, wasn't good - I don't think I will ever order that again, from anywhere. They also left the plastic wrapper on one of my imitation crab sticks.. 
Likely will not return unless I am completely out of options.
author: Mimi L.

description:
Since 2015, the place improved and I went back to eating there once a week.  However, there's been another change in ownership.  Ugh!

The chairs are all mismatched, the lighting seems brighter/harsher, and there is different "stuff" on the walls.  Those things were my first tip off to new owners.  

The food is just not up to snuff and the portions (eating in or take out) are definitely smaller.
author: Terri K.

description: It was okay. Had the duck soup. The broth was really tasty, and the noodles were good, but the duck was mostly fat. The bits that weren't pure fat were tasty, though. The service was eh. They didn't mind me sitting there for an hour, though, probably because there were only 2 other people in there.
author: Mi M.

description:
Not sure what happened here - I used to come here all the time when I was a San Francisco State student. I decided to come again and noticed all the changes.

Cash register ordering? Okay, maybe they're trying something new.
Patio chairs for seating? Guess that must be their new motif.
Water is self-served in paper cups? That's uh...different.
All food comes in to go boxes even if you wanted to eat in? I guess they want to save us the trouble of talking to them again for a to go box if we don't finish.

However, when they gave me a tiny plastic spoon for my Tom Yong Soup (which wasn't even that good, it was all mushrooms - they charged extra for noodles), that's when I made the decision to never come back.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
The food was simply OK, a bit overpriced for the quality.

The egg rolls were very over fried. The curry was good, but again just OK.

Pricing is a little high.
author: James D.

description: THEY SERVE EVERYTHING IN TOGO BOXES for dine in! Still charging regular price with the smallest little bento looking boxes. Very disappointing, this was my go to place especially for their 2 entree and 1 appetizer deal. Me and my friends are never coming back.
author: Steph L.

description:
I used to come here all the time for take out since it's so close to my house.  Today I ordered the pad see ew with beef, and the basil eggplant with ground chicken.  

The flavors are typically pretty good and today's food tasted ok, but the beef in the pad see ew was inedible, so tough I spit it out and didn't even bother with the rest of it.  The basil eggplant also did not have ground chicken but was instead sliced and because of this, was also very dry and over cooked.  

I'm not sure what happened to this place because I used to love it, but I guess will be ordering elsewhere now.  :(
author: Christina W.

description: Thai owned and managed place with decent prices and moderately sized portions.  We liked most of our dishes and would definitely order from here again.  Remember it is Thai despite the generic name and it is on Sloat!  We ordered for pickup and it was ready in the exact amount of time they told us (20 minutes for 6 dishes)
author: Ken T.

description:
I really hate to do this... I believe there must have been a change in ownership.  I used to love coming here and it was my go to place for Thai food.  

Tonight I went in and got my usual "yellow curry chicken" the soup base was delicious but the potatoes and onions were raw. The chicken tasted rubbery and was very bland. 

Also ordered fried rice and it was so bland. It tasted like rice with egg no other flavor. 

I'm disappointed. 

I can't give it less than 2 stars because I know it's a mom and pop shop.  I'm hoping they step up their food game otherwise I will no longer be a customer.
author: Sheree A.

description:
If you plan on eating in, or getting take-out, your food will come in to-go containers regardless. A few friends and I came here one night and ordered to eat in. They served our food in to-go containers rather than plates. What's the point of having tables if everything is just going to be in to-go containers anyways? 

Upon ordering, you have to grab their attention. Actually, they look at you, and stare at you, but they don't say anything. My friend was looked at and it was awkward to the point where she had to say "Uhm, can I order?" Customer service was disappointing. 

ANYWAYS, the food was meh. I ordered the yellow curry with chicken, my friend ordered pad see ew with chicken, and my other friend ordered a mixed veggie plate. The chicken was rubbery, but the curry itself wasn't bad, hence the one star. The best plate, in my opinion, was the mixed veggie plate.

HOWEVER, a few hours after eating the food, I got the runs. It was not pleasant. I thought it could have been something I've eaten earlier in the day. I later heard from my friends the next morning that they had also gotten the runs, and one was extremely sick. Probably because of the chicken, or the place was unsanitary. Whatever it was, we will not be returning.

All in all, one star for the flavor of the curry.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
December 22, 2016 -- San Francisco, CA

The Noodle House formerly known as King of Thai 
Noodle House, is located at 1507 Sloat Boulevard, 
cross street Havenside Drive, inside the Lakeshore 
Plaza, San Francisco 94132.

This Thai eatery is situated across from Ono 
Hawaiian BBQ, on the left side of Peet's Coffee, 
and on the right side of Gymboree Play & Music.

We were warmly greeted upon arrival and immediately 
seated. The service staff were attentive, friendly and 
knowledgeable. They were able to maintain good eye
contact. We noticed a stream of customers coming in 
to pickup their take-out orders. Finding a parking 
space was reasonably easy even during late night 
and weekends.

The tender Chicken Satay arrived in five BBQ sticks, 
served with creamy peanut sauce and cucumber salad 
on the side.

Their Gang Khew Warn (Green Curry Shrimp) came 
with bell peppers, bamboo shoots, green long beans 
and basil. The eight pieces of pink shrimp were 
perfectly cooked in thick coconut milk.

The Tom Kam Gai is the Thai soup with coconut milk. 
It had fresh sliced button mushrooms, tender white 
chicken slices and lemon grass.

The price of the food was affordable and reasonable 
for the location. The servings were appropriate for 
the price.

A wheelchair will fit inside their single unisex ADA 
compliant bathroom.

We will definitely come back for more authentic Thai 
cuisine.

Ambiance: Casual dining
Credit cards: Yes
Decor: Good
Food: Very good
Noise level: Conversation is easy
Price: $
Parking: Street
Service: Fast, courteous
Overall satisfaction: Very good


The Noodle House
1507 Sloat Boulevard
San Francisco, CA 94132
415.566.9921
author: Ed D.

description:
It is convenient, and the food comes out quickly. I'd say I've had better for the price margins, but perhaps it just depends on the palette. The service wasn't terribly attentive even with just a few people in the restaurant, and having two servers working at the time. This is just a general observation since service like this exists at a lot of Asian restaurants. Anyway I ordered the pad mau keur with tofu and veggies. 

*Side note: there are a lot of restaurants where I want to order meat for 50 cents to a dollar more just because it's a fuller portion. This would be one of them. This isn't to say there's a great amount of food, there just wasn't much tofu.

The sauce was salty, especially for using a sweet soy sauce. The consistency of the veggies differed here and there, some felt pre-prepared. Some had a good slight crunch as opposed to mush. Others not so much. The eggplant sorta fell apart. Due to how it was, it soaked up a bunch of the sauce and was salty too. The rest was ok but scarfing down rice to balance the flavor in my mouth grew tiresome. The one thing I did really like was the amount of basil. I adore basil. It makes food shine in flavor to me.

I also got their tofu salad mini takeout. It was good but mostly because of the 6 dollar price idk if I would it again. The peanut sauce was yummy. Again, little tofu. Nothing to write home about overall.
author: David C.

description: Ended up here since there wasn't much choice in the shopping mall... ordered just the pad Thai and papaya salad and were sadly disappointed. Both had an uncharacteristic sweet-sour taste and not at all what you get in these dishes usually. Also, the noodles of the pad Thai were not the usual thick rice noodles... will not be going back...
author: Angela O.

description: Took my family there, first time. Feb 25th. We had been searching for a place to have lunch. I should have read the reviews first. Ordered one of their signature dishes, the chicken wings. Disappointed! Chicken was over cooked, tuff and tiny pieces. Really not edible. Told the two ladies there serving and they just said, ok, thanks. Also ordered Guay Tiew Talay and Tom Kha. Both bland, no flavor. Atmosphere is bleak and unsure of it's self. Splash of color here and there. If you need to eat, they ok but if you have choices, move on. This is a vary last choice in my book. No, we will not be going back.
author: Tommy F.

description:
Tried this place for the first time today. Not to shabby.

Came in around 11:30 and didn't even have to wait! I went straight to the counter and asked for a menu. I went with my usual order the Pad Kea Moa. I waited and sat for awhile as my food was prepared. 

There was a group of gentlemen enjoying their meal while I waited. The lady that helped me was very nice and patient. 

I had never been hear before so I took time to look over this place. Not too bad in size and the seating is good if you decide to come here with a group of people.

Apparently this place does deliver orders which was a surprise! 

After getting my order I headed back to my spot to eat my lunch. I opened up the container after taking a seat. The food looked good.

The portion was smaller than some of the other places that I have been to but I got over it quickly. I did like seeing all the peppers bursting from the my meal though!!!! First bite was just RIGHT!! 

I could taste all my usual spicy flavors which is good when it comes to consistency of the same meal. Good stuff. Glad that I made my way here today. I would consider coming back just to try their in restaurant service.

#thaitime
author: Robert F.

description: Nothing really to rave about.  I ordered the beef meat ball noodles via Ubereats. The soup base was average.  I was hungover and it was the only Thai restaurant that delivered noodle soup in 30 minutes. I'll probably order from them again, but only when I'm hungover and desperate.
author: Joanie S.

description: Good friendly service. Food selection is good and the soups are great on a cold day. Fresh food and a good prilce and local location.
author: Andrew M.

description:
What happened to The Noodle House on Sloat?  We used to refer to it as our kitchen, a place we could sit down and enjoy friendly service and large portions of delicious but inexpensive Thai food. It closed for remodeling two weeks ago. It has reopened - and what happened?  The menu is "the same" - as in, same items at the same prices. But now everything is served in to go containers. The food is not as tasty. The worst part is that the portions are half of what they used to be!  Really?  I'm supposed to pay the same prices for half the food and eat from a small plastic bowl with splintery chopsticks and a tiny plastic spoon?  No way. 

What an enormous disappointment. We will never return. Such a shame.
author: G C.

description:
Have been coming here for years and it's always been decent. Good portion sizes and flavours...until recently. 

Now the portions are so incredibly small that one plate isn't enough to for a full meal. Prices have definitely stayed the same at around $10-11 per plate, but portion sizes are super skimpy. 

Horrible portion sizes are not the only problem here. Some of the dishes are pretty bland and watered down, particularly the curries. Also wouldn't recommend the tamarind chicken wings- they're over cooked and lacked sauce to keep the meat flavourful. 

Overall, the food is eh. The basil eggplant is good and so is the pad Thai! Wouldn't order yellow curry or chicken wings again. 

Would only consider coming back for a snack, not a full meal.
author: Jessica C.

description: Ordered beef/rice dish along with beef noodle soup. Beef had no taste & very chewy! Chicken wings with tamarind sauce was disappointing & bland & expensive. Was really disappointed
author: Nsrchofrnr S.

description: We ordered via Uber Eats. The Salad with Peanut sauce was delish! So was the Tom Yummmm
author: Amber Renee C.

description:
Love this place!

They're right around the corner from my house and their Pad Kee Mao with whatever meat you decide is always consistently tasty!

Super easy and quick for takeout friendly staff and reasonable prices


Give it a try!
author: Ken L.

description: The food is not worth the price you pay. Regardless if you want to dine in or want the food to-go, your food will be served in to-go containers. Also, remember to remove your invisible cloak when you enter the restaurant so the employees can see you... With their shitty quality of food comes the consequences of having to shit ALL FUCKING DAY FROM FOOD POISONING! Save your time, money, stomach, and life people !!!
author: Hazel L.

description: The price was too high for the small portion of food. Pad Thai only can with 3 shrimp! Really? That's all you can include is three lousy shrimp ? Reminder, this is strip mall food! Lower your price! Quality of food was also average at best and the guy at the counter never cracked a smile. I would at least expect a grin when your screwing me out of shrimp!
author: Andrew K.

description: I guess they should change the name of the place to 'the worst noodle house'. I ordered take out as I wasn't feeling so good but after first bite I decided to cook for myself. Not sure how they are even surviving as a restaurant with food I just ate.
author: Arpita P.

description: We've been going to this casual spot for its entire existence.  The food's good and it's just been a homey little spot for our family. And in San Francisco, it's no small thing that you can park there. But recently the Noodle House  switched to a takeout format, where everything is served in strictly takeout containers; you can sit down and eat there if you want, but it no longer feels like going out to eat. We always have gotten takeout there sometimes as well as dining in, but it isn't really pleasant for dining in anymore. We'd like the old format back.
author: Caroline G.

description: I've been coming here for years and I'm surprised I haven't wrote a review yet. I normally get the rice dishes here.   Usually the chicken and thai basil over rice or the crab fried rice.  I know i should try something new but I love the chicken and thai basil over rice. It's perfect on a rainy day, because the spices give you a perfect kick.   There's lots if chicken and bell peppers in this dish, and you still have an option to add more spices. On the table they have 4 different hot sauce/spices for you to add.  I normally like the dry one with flake , followed by the spicy oil.   The crab fried rice is usually a little bland so I always add my spices.  They used to be cash only but now they take card!
author: Belinda C.

description: I got crab fried rice...the crab was definitely not fresh! It tasted so disgusting. I took one bite and I told my boyfriend not to eat it.
author: Daniella S.

description:
My friend and I usually treat ourselves to The Noodle House after a gruesome day where we both opt out of cooking! He raves that this place tastes very authentic. Having never been to Thailand myself, I can second that this place does offer delicious tasting thai food! All the expected flavors are there: the curry, the spice, and everything nice (ha!). I've tried their pad thai and pumpkin curry. Both are delicious! My friend always goes with the pananag, spicy!!!! I also like how they preserve water. They will serve it to you upon request. But lets be real, you should be having a thai iced tea anyways. 

added bonus: prices are affordable and they deliver!
author: Sarin P.

description:
Cheap, fast, near school. What else can I say? Sometimes I just want a quick Thai fix and don't want to fancy dine in places like Marnee Thai where I feel like I'll spend more than 1 hr enjoyin their ambiance than their food. 

Food is good and big portion. I've tried several dishes and overall I'm happy. Service is good too. No complaints!
author: Debbie D.

description: It's probably the most terrible Thai food I've ever had. They gave you the least amount of noodle, a ton of sauce and some lowest quality meat. The pad see yu is so sweet and salty, inedible. The chicken noodle has tiny bit of noodle and some dry chicken breast bits and pieces. Their ton yum kon is extremely salty with tons of MSG - inedible. It doesn't matter if you tell them or not; they ignore you. Bottom line, please stay away.
author: Woopie P.

description:
No longer King of Thai quality level, sadly.

I used to love this place in 2014-15 but lately the food prep leaves alot to be desired.  They also shrunk portions last year. 

They may have changed out the chefs that knew how to cook Thai.  Last time I ordered I got Pad See Ew and Pad Kee Mao.  There was little difference between what was in the two dishes and both tasted blandly bad; noodles clumped together.  Worse yet though, I was the first takeout customer one Saturday and wound up with stomach distress.  The food tasted funny and my best guess is they got cleaning products from the kitchenware in my food.

C'mon you guys, get it together!  I miss getting takeout here.
author: Femita J.

description: I started coming here in 2011 when I went to high school nearby, but the quality has gone downhill at a staggering rate. I used to order their curries and their fried rice with fried chicken. Over time, the portions have gotten smaller and the taste has become more bland. The other night, the beef curry I ordered tasted as if it was made with beef jerkey; the meat was slightly pink, soft, and extremely chewy. This was probably the last time I'd consider eating here again. What a shame, this used to be a great spot!
author: Clarissa M.

description:
First time here was yesterday. I ordered combo beef noodle soup. It was HUGE! and the price was reasonable (less than 8$) including tax.
Well, i would say Yes, it is well worth for the price. 

BTW all waitress are so generious and very kind to me.

This is my fav spots ever. Hands down. I come here atleast 5 times a week. Lol
author: Weerachai P.

description: This is a good Thai restaurant. Food is excellent and the service is good. It is not a fancy place but its clean. I usually get the chicken wings, potstickers, egg rollsand curry chicken to go. If you don't have a lot of time and you want good thai food, this is it.
author: Victor Y.

description: Normally I don't give bad reviews but this place is surprisingly bad. My mom ordered a pad thai and it came in a disposable container even though we were eating in. When she opened he box there was maybe one small plate worth of food. That's $9.95 right there! Then my dad's noodle soup came in a disposable plastic bowl. Lots of beef balls so I'll give them that. But again barely full bowl. Then my Rad Na noodles came in a plastic bowl in which the gravy sauce was watered down. Hardly any taste to it. And the bowl was half full. That's $10.95! Altogether our meal came out to about $35 including tax and tip. Save yourself the trouble and don't come here.
author: Janice W.

description: Ordered take out for curry and rice but when I arrived home and got ready to eat dinner, the rice smelled spoiled.  I cook and eat rice throughout my life and I absolutely know what spoiled rice smells like and the rice definitely smelled spoiled. They said I can have a free order of my dish but guess what?  I am never ever going there again... they lost my business.  This goes for all restaurants, so nothing personal to that restaurant...
author: Emiliano M.

description:
I have been coming here since before my Yelping days. I have a soft spot for this place because I used to frequent this place back when I lived in the area and when I was a poor undergrad. Is the food here amazing? No. Is it a place you will take people from out of town? Probably not. However, it's a casual place where you can find not super authentic Thai food at relatively cheap prices. When you walk in, it looks like a hole in the wall place with their basic sometimes-wobbly-wooden tables and chairs. Yes, not much of a grand ambiance here but it doesn't try to pass off as some classy place.

The menu is standard and you'll find the usual popular Thai dishes like pad thai, pad see ewe, and an assortment of curries. I've had the pad see ewe, pad kee mao, and duck noodle soup here and they were all decent. Nothing to rave about but also nothing to complain about either.

The service has always been good and the food never takes too long to arrive at the table. Granted, there typically doesn't seem to be a lot of people dining here even during peak lunch and dinner hours. 

If you're looking for a great Thai restaurant, this isn't it. If you're looking for a place where you can have a decent meal for less than $10, come check it out!
author: Christina S.

description:
This was the BEST THAI food I have ever had. Amazing taste!!!  I'm so happy that I have found this little
Place and randomly walked in. I highly recommend it if you r looking for taste authentic Thai food.
author: J C.

description: I've ordered the fried chicken tamarind & it had 7 small chicken wings for $9... The portion size is way too small for one person & costly... Secondly the cashier is rude & unfriendly to accept my cash payment... Made me wait while, he answered a call... Very disappointed & will never eat there again...I wish i can give it zero stars...
author: Arnel F.

description:
This is my first time here. I was not in the mood for Thai food but decided to go since I was with family that wanted to go.

Decor is ok with purple walls but seems a bit out of place and needs an update. Seats are a bit sticky.

Food is ok at best. I ordered the Tom Yum Goong soup with shrimp and silver noodles.  It did not have the lemongrass that this soup is known to have and it was extremely spicy. It was lacking but I just can't figure out what it was. I'm a little bummed out that I went here and wasted my stomach and money.
author: Flora H.

description:
Pad see ew is probably my second favorite thai noodle dish, pad thai being the first. This place has pad see ew listed as "pad see lew," so i initially thought that was a different dish entirely. Not sure if thats a typo or if thats the correct spelling all along. ..who knows. Anyway, that was what i ended up ordering. 

The pad see ew here is definitely better tasting than some of the other thai restaurants'. A friend of ours ordered the tom yum soup, and said hers was really good as well.  Im anxious to return and ultimately taste their pad thai.

The restaurant was really, really dim .. Borderline dark.  Was that their intent? Lol. Service was ok, our waitress was nice but not at all attentive.  Came by to take our order and once again at the end to give our checks and box up our leftovers.
author: Abby Q.

description: This used to be a nice sit-down restaurant. Now it's self-serve: you order at the counter with the same menu, they serve in to-go container and the portions are way smaller. They have only about 5 tables. Looks like they are getting ready to close shop for good. The server said they've changed the system, short handed and no one doing dishes in the back..  I will not be coming back here!!!!
author: G J.

description:
I think the first time I ate at this location was during my senior year of high school which was over seven years ago. I thought the pad thai here was pretty darn good. Of course, things change. I think King of Thai makes decent thai food but when I'm craving it, this wouldn't be on the top of my list of thai food restaurants. 

Just to recollect my memory of the restaurant, I recently picked up some pad thai and pad kee mao with chicken for dinner. Service in the restaurant was friendly and I appreciated all of the seating, as well as separate seating for those waiting for a pick-up order such as myself. I enjoyed the pad kee mao noodles but I felt that both noodle dishes were just dry. I remember the pad thai being saucier, and the pad kee mao just wasn't up to par. 

This location still has King of Thai's iconic lavender walls but for some reason, the "King of Thai" letters were removed and it just says, "Noodle House" in front of the restaurant. Not sure if that's getting fixed or if this location is disassociating itself with the King.
author: Maya S.

description: What?    Average review is only 2 stars?    What has yelp become?   A place for whiners?    This place is great.     Solid 4.    Yummy and cheap.  Their #33 ground pork is the best.     But I wish they give a bit more rice since I like to mix rice with sauce.    Given the price this place is very reasonable!
author: Emily C.

description: 3 stars for their yummy Beef Pad Kee Mao, basil leaf beef, and Tom yum soup. My staple order whenever I here, SOOOO good!!!!! I love this place since it is a little closer to my house than King Of Thai on Taraval and Clement.
author: Amanda R.

description: This place is under new management which seems to be doing a better job all around. There is a lot more meat in the dishes which I appreciate and the staff is warm and efficient. I had the BBQ pork over rice special. It was cooked fresh and seasoned well. I'll be back to try the soups  and pad Thai!
author: Bella L.

description: This place is awesome!! I've been here a couple times and never been disappointed. This place is super easy to get to from SFSU if you're looking for something easy and fast! Would recommend anyone to check this place out
author: Katelyn K.

description:
(Scene from Bambi)

Thumper: "He doesn't walk very good does he?"

Mrs. Rabbit:  "Thumper, What did your father tell you this morning?"

Thumper:  "If you can't say something nice, don't say nothing at all.". Here's a clip:  

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nGt9jAkWie4&feature=youtube_gdata_player

For the most part I live by this.  No need to slam restaurants.  Usually I'll just not write anything about them.  But today, I'm not Thumper, and King of Noodle ain't no Bambi.  

Everything I ordered here didn't taste good.  You ever eat a bad burrito and ask yourself "How does all the same ingredients, at different taquerias, create a burrito that taste so different?" One tasting good and the other taqueria bad.  Same thing happened here.  I love Thai food.  But King of Thai, royally messed up the same ingredients.

In my Thumper voice "They don't cook very good, do they"?  Here's what I ordered:

Tom Yum Soup:  It was spicy, sour, sweet, and terrible.  I can't put my finger on it, actually I can, I can literally put my finger on the soup.. Not good.

Pad Thai:  it was extremely tart with lack of flavor.

Roast Duck with rice:  this dish was actually not terrible.  I like the duck flavor and the bed of rice covered in duck sauce.  If I had to go again, this would be my dish.

Service was lacking.  The kids that worked here were too busy taking photos of each other and cooking themselves something to eat.  But whatever.  If the food was good, they could be playing Twister in the middle of the restaurant and I wouldn't have cared.  Just make good food, that's all I ask. 

So I want to say sorry to Thumper's mom, I really didn't have anything nice to say.  But I promise next time... I won't say nothing at all.
author: Michael L.

description:
The food here does not only taste plain, but also very old. We work in the area, and ate there a few times, just because we wanted to add variety to the restaurants we usually eat. Every time, we hoped that it will be better. But this is absolutely the last time we've done that! 

This time I've ordered Chicken Pad Thai, and my business partner had a Nam Tok salad with pork. My pad thai was basically one SOLID piece of noodle with a few pieces of chicken and crushed nuts on top. It had no taste and smelled old. From what it looks like they took old food, microwaved it, and sold it to me. Then the salad that my friend/colleague had ordered was basically a quarter of a cabbage head NOT chopped, a few leaves of salad, red chopped onions and a few pieces of pork. And we paid around $20 for that (with tax). If we wanted to  get a non-chopped cabbage and leaves, we would have just walked a few more steps to Lucky's, and bought it all there. At least it would have been more fresh. If they are so lazy about small things like that, I don't want to even think about their sanitary standards in the kitchen.

To sum up, the food there is horrible. If the owners are not passionate enough about the quality of their food, then they should go do something else for everyone's sake.
author: Valentin T.

description:
Yay! Love this place. Granted it's not the bestest Thai in the world, but it's close to my house and they know me so they hook it up. Been coming here for years and the service is always quick and friendly. 

The food is pretty consistent, though there have been a few times that the curry was a little watery. Good people, good place and friendly environment. Must have dish: Fried chicken over fried rice. Best in the city and I've had it all. Please trust in the fried chicken over fried rice and you WILL be HAPPY!! :) And the Thai iced tea is damn good too. I wish this place wasn't cash only. I would come here more often if they took card.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
King of Thai?
Not any more.  Rushing in for a Friday late lunch, I didn't bother to look at the signage or even the menu for the restaurant name.  Been coming here for about six years occasionally for lunch, usually opting for either their fried chicken and fried rice plate or pad Thai or pad see ew.
On this overcast weekday, soup noodles was my choice, perfect cure for feeling under the weather.  The bowl of Guay Tiew Look Chin Pla was pretty large and had no shortage of ingredients (chicken, ground pork, fish cakes, bean sprouts in a clear chicken broth).  Wish there were a little less fish cake slices though.  We also shared their Hoi Jor, basically deep fried yuba skins wrapping grounded pork, water chestnuts, crab meat and shrimp; this comes with a plum sauce for dipping but do use their table side spicy garlic sauce and/or peppers to supplement the flavor.
We came in on the late side, after 2 pm, so there were only two other tables filled.  This would have been a 4.5 star review save the mixup on my noodle choice ( wanted ho fun, got rice noodles); at least, they offered to redo it but we were pressed for time.
Still in lunch rotation when in the neighborhood.
author: Mike C.

description:
Seriously disappointed with the service on this occasion. We have been here a few times before and service was fine until now. 

on this particular occasion i was seriously sick and craved for their glass noodle soup ( #40 on their to go menu.)

The BF was kind enough to order & deliver to me.  To my disappointment what I ordered was not in the bag. When he went back to inquire, the lady simply told him he was wrong and that #40 was not a soup but curry (?!?!)   After a small debate she realized that it was a typo on the menu but still argued that it wasn't their fault and "things happen". She wanted us to return the food and would remake the soup. 

We returned the food ( not that I could eat it anyway) but the decided not to get the soup because of the unapologetic attitude and aggravation  we had to go through. 

These must be new owners. I hope they update their embed and give better service to others in the future, but sadlyI won't be back for a long time
author: Linda D.

description: This place is not a place to rave about, but I enjoy eating here everytime because it isn't too loud and the workers are nice. I typically come here at night when I am craving thai food, since they close later than some other places. The food is decent, I've tried their Peanut sauce dish (pra ram i think) and the tofu pad thai -- it filled me up. Overall I'm pretty satisfied.
author: Deneb T.

description: The food has gone down hill big time. I remember when this place was King of Thai and the food was really good but not not anymore. I will not be back and do not recommend this place.
author: Brad A.

description:
Not sure why this place has only 3.5 stars. 
Great Thai food. I always judge a Thai restaurant by the Thai Tea. 9 times out of 10 if you can do tea then your food is great. 
The menu items have a little different names then the topical Thai place but it's easy to find your way around the menu.  The Pad See Ew by far one of the best I have ever had. (I always get this dish in replacement of pad Thai because I am allergic to peanuts.) The Pad See Ew has a flavorful garlic taste. We also tried a fried rice dish as well.
author: Alegra H.

description: This used to be my favorite Thai restaurant, not anymore. Their portions have become much much smaller than before, the fish cake and cucumber salad have become one third the size it used to be, the diameter went from 3 inches to 1 inch. The reason I was given was "it's more because it's more thick", but the thickness remained the same. The price went up from $7 to $9 though.
author: Josr C.

description:
My favorite dishes are the kao prik sod with beef over rice, the yellow chicken curry over rice, and the pad kee mao with pork. The dishes are very flavorful. Thai iced tea is good, too.

I will say that they are cash only, so that's a little inconvenient. They use to be King of Thai Noodle (at Sloat) but changed their name... Food, dishes, and people who work here are the same.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Formerly known as King of Thai, it has good basic Thai options, but a little over-priced. I appreciate that they take cards now as it used to be cash only.
author: Stefan M.

description:
After an intense workout, we decided to have lunch at KOT on sloat.  Not only is this the closest location to us BUT I love how the have a special menu which allows you to order 1 appetizer, and 2 entrees for $18!  This might seem a lot for 2 people for lunch (and it was) but we ordered it anyways.  

Fried Wontons were really nice and crispy.
You Really can't go wrong with Pad Kee Mao.  I usually order the Pad See Ew but decided to switch it up.  A little spice in your life can't hurt.
The fried chicken over fried rice was good.  It's something I wouldn't normally order only cause I'm "trying" (not that hard obviously) to eat healthier but it wasn't bad.

In the end, food won.  We left with to go boxes (very rare) but hey, we made two meals out of one!
author: Linda N.

description:
Food: The Pad Thai here is pretty good, although sometimes the noodles can get stuck and a bit clumpy.  Usually it's ok.  You can do their special with 2 entrees and an appetizer for under $20.  The best KoT I've been to are the ones in the Richmond.  This one closes at 10:30 PM.  Their Thai Ice Teas are really good here.

Location: I've been coming here for a while now.  It's in the boonies of the Lakeshore Plaza across the Gamestop and next to where the now defunct Blockbuster used to be at.  Their new sign doesn't say King of Thai anymore though.  Strange.

Parking: Usually lots of parking in this lot so it shouldn't be a problem.

Service: Service is spectacular.  The waiters/waitresses are very friendly and will cater to your needs.

Wi-Fi: You can snatch onto Peets Wi-Fi when you're at this King of Thai.  Not too shabby.

I would give it 5 stars but this place is CASH ONLY.  I'm personally not big on cash so you can always walk into the Lucky's around the corner for the Bank of America ATM.
author: Wilson K.

description:
Maybe a 3.5. Its a shame there's no cheap thai places in sf. Believe me, I've tried looking. This place and along with king of thai would be the cheapest you can get. Unfortunately I don't think this place tastes authentic... Not that I would know what authentic thai taste like. But I know that there are some places (mostly outside of sf) where I go flipping crazy over thai food!!! I've gotten the boat noodle soup, the pad kee Mao, the Tom yum noodle soup. They're more sweeter than what I'm used to (not a compliment).

As you can tell I'm a noodle person, although their curries are good too. I never tried the fried rice. Next time I'm here I'll try it even though I'm never in the mood for fried rice!!!

I recommend the Tom yum noodle soup out of everything that I've tried! It's not as sour as other places but..it's sour enough that that's my favorite dish here.
author: Stephanie W.

description: holy hell im not even sure what to say... this place is not the same as it was a month ago. was told by the cashier, this place is self service, everything is take out now but you can still dine in at the tables with plastic patio chairs and stools while you eat out of your to go container. they don't have a dishwasher anymore apparently. imagine eating at a food cart/truck but without the truck. thats the vibe, yep, yeahhhhhhhhh, pass.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Pretty quite at night. They closed very late which I like it. The food taste is same like any other Thai noodle restaurant.
author: Daisy C.

description: Service was friendly and food was decent. I enjoyed it. I ordered the pad see lew, there were two other dishes from their meal special but can't remember name of them. Would go again to eat.
author: Serena Z.

description: Surprisingly good food and low prices compared to other Thai places. Got dinner here with my bf the other night and I got the pumpkin curry, which came with rice. The curry was really good, and definitely had some spice to it. There was also a good proportion of curry to rice, unlike some places. He got beef noodle soup with wide flat noodles, which was also really good. The servers were friendly and kept our water cups refilled without asking! I'd reccommend this place for a good cheap Thai meal.
author: Sze-Wing L.

description:
This place is not the KING of Thai Noodle House that I know.  In fact, they are just called The Noodle House.  As far as I am concerned, they are good for Thai when you're in a pinch.  Once of those situation where you really, really need Thai food, but you're just a little too far to go across town for it.  Or, as in my case, about to be sliced open by some very nice people at UCSF Medical Center and really craving Thai as a potential last meal.  I was ordered to stay within a certain area of the hospital, so my options were limited.

However, The Noodle House worked.  The Pad Thai, Red Curry and Basil Fried Rice were all good.  NOT great, but good.  The absolute worst part was that when we came to pick up our to go order, the person who packed the back stacked the containers vertically like books.  So, even though we noticed this in the restaurant and asked for a new bag so we could repack it ourselves, most of the sauce and drippings had already left their respective containers and created a colorful Thai slurry in the bottom of our bag.

So, this place makes my list of places to go if you don't have other options, or if you're too lazy to take advantage of those other options.
author: Nick M.

description:
The ladies here are so friendly! Love their service and happy tone of voice :) 

F O O D   W I S E...
The Pad-See-Ew - little dry and on the saltier side.

Guay Tiew Luay - (not sure if I spelled it right but it's the seafood noodle soup one #12) VERY bland, almost no taste whatsoever. I couldn't finish the soup and decided to mix the noodles in the soup with my Pad-See-Ew to neutralize the flavors. 

Green Curry with Tofu and vegetable - too milky for my taste and slightly flavorless.

Overall, okay quality. I'm not sure if it will be my first preference to go back but I wouldn't mind if I'm nearby and craving Thai food just because their service is great!
author: Anna L.

description: If you want something different this is the place!! Very good food and service was fast. I give this place 5 orales. A must try!!!
author: Daniel L. d.

description:
Stick with what the locals eat in Thailand. The Pad Thai was a little too sweet. But overall, I'll be back to try other well put together dishes. 

Choose. Local. Favorites.
author: Edgar M.

description:
Food is a *** 
Service *
 
I come here maybe 3-5 times a year. Cuz I live close by. I came here last night. Everything was ok until we paid. My BF paid with a $100 for a $20.55 meal. But when we got our change back we notice it was short $10. They only give us $69.45 in change. I told the waitress she immediately apologized and went to the register to get us our $10. 

My bf believed it's a honest mistake. He still tipped them and we just left without making a big deal of it. I don't know what to think of it. I am writing this review so ppls can becareful when paying with cash.
author: Lu L.

description:
Tried a few of their dishes and it is definitely a miss. There are so many better Thai restaurants out there than this semi chain.

Their number 32 (boneless duck over rice) cost about $10. For the same price and portion you can go into sunset/richmond and get a mix of BBQ pork/roastbeef and amazing duck over rice for less than that. 

I've tried their pad thai and it lacked a lot of flavors.

Pricey and service isn't great.

Won't be back.
author: Wilson P.

description:
Cheap! They always once in awhile don't put plastic utensils in the to go! How am I supposed to eat? With my hands?! Seriously man...

Please note, this location is NOODLE HOUSE now! And their duck fried rice, sucks! The rice is as hard as a rock! The left over rice taste like it was cooked with too little water! Not to mention, there's not much of anything with the rice. Skimped out on everything but rice!!

DONT COME HERE! 

Terrible!
author: ABC Z.

description:
Eeek! Is this place king of thai? Or just changed their name to save the shame? Out of all the kot's i've dined at, this one is hands down my least favorite/bottom of the list. 

You know when you're really hungry, any ordinary meal tastes amazing? Well it wasnt the case here! I came with my boyfriend on a saturday and we were suuuuper hungry. We ordered the thai tea, fish cake, rad nar, and beef stew noodle soup. 

Thai tea - skip this, it has no flavor and should be more creamy in my opinion.

Fish cake - this was the best of the three. Slight tom yum essence and the flavors really stood out.

Rad nar - it is the flat noodles with gravy and chicken. It was mostly a small island of noodles surrounded by an ocean of gravy. Why skimp out on the starches? I had to order an extra side of white rice to balance the sauce/starch ratio.

Beef stew - they also skimped out on the noodles here. My boyfriend switched from rice noodles to flat noodles and it seemed they only gave him 5 fat ribbons. The broth was also very watered down.

Overall, we just ate all the food because we were hungry. We didn't enjoy it for the most part. Although the menu may be the same, this place is NOT like king of thai in terms of flavor, quality, and consistency. So dont come here expecting it to be or you will be disappointed.
author: Tina O.

description: Decent Thai food. The duck noodle soup and yellow curry with duck are my go tos. My bf tried the duck larb salad today but it was mediocre and skimpy for its price! 9$ for a palm size serving!!! We shoulda just stuck to champa garden or at least king of Thai on Taraval since their portions are bigger. I would only come here if I'm too lazy to drive :p
author: Michelle H.

description:
ate here and im never eating here again. 
i ordered roasted duck over rice and i found some bug in it. the bug was in my mouth and i spit it out because i felt something sharp scrape my tongue.  i will upload a photo for everyone to see. i am so traumatized.
author: Brenda K.

description: This location is alright.. all KOT in my opinion are the same.. however I was really pleased with my duck curry I had last night for dinner (although I don't think it's completely worth it because I only had like one or two pieces of duck and the rest was fat and skin pieces) and my friend and fellow yelper Vikki K's tom yum noodle soup. Everything was tasty and the service was okay. It was slightly hard to get the attention of the workers but nonetheless they were friendly. I also left my phone on the table while I was leaving and thankfully right when I got back in they handed me my phone. THANK YOU!
author: Tiff C.

description: The service was fast and friendly, I took the food home to go and was pleasantly surprised with how tasty the pork was, noodles were perfect, fresh veggies. I'll def go back.
author: Chris H.

description: I'm being generous admittedly.  We were told there was no stars or heat rating, so, "a little spicy" would be 3 stars.  There are way too many choices for food in this town to serve food this bad.  The phad thai was so dry, chicken flavorless and chalky cardboard in texture.  My wife's noodle dish had zero sauce, extremely over done vegetables.  There is absolutely no chance I would ever give them my business again.  2 stars is simply because the girl behind the counter was nice and the "food" came out quickly.  There are several other choices within the complex that are far better options and deserving of your business
author: Geoff B.

description: I always get my food to go from this Thai place...probably about 4-6 times a month. I like their basil beef and the duck fried rice. Decent portion for the price. Their thai iced tea is pretty good too.
author: Phi N.

description:
Open 1030a-1030p, cash only (asian place, surprise). 

I liked this place, the menu is extensive, portions are generous. 

We ordered pad thai, the #17, #15, some larb salad, and something else that I cannot remember. All were pretty tasty.

Service was quick, restaurant is clean.
author: Spencer H.

description:
How did this place get 3 stars?
Service, feels like we owe the person money
Beef noodle soup ... looks like hot water with soy sauce and sugar
Pineapple fried rice ... below average chinese chow fun with 3 small shrimps and few pale pieces of pineapples
 

Ok i decided to add one more star cuz the server just said thank you bye bye
author: gswfan ..

description:
I don't know why I thought I was desperate enough to get takeout here. I should've just got Hawaiian BBQ across the street.

This place charged me almost $30 for measly portions of takeout. Maybe if I ate there the servings would be much bigger but I felt ripped off.

The chicken my sister got was so dry and rubbery she ended up feeding the leftovers to the dog.  I got a salad that had a few pieces of lettuce. One good thing was the tanginess of the spicy-lime sauce. That was one of the few exceptions.

I probably will not go back again.
author: Julia Q.

description: Two thumbs meh. It wasn't bad, but I won't be going back at all. I had the #2 beef ball soup, which was kinda like nutmeg and oil broth, and I had the #47 which was good. But all fried food is good, so.....
author: Susanne A.

description:
THE Thai chain restaurant of San Francisco.
The Tom-Yum-Goong, pad see ew, and pad thai are good.
entree order recommendations : basil beef and green or panand curries
The fried chicken over thai fried rice is a great lunch order.

What's special on the menu is the herbal duck noodle soup - get it with the small rice noodles.
author: Kent T.

description:
Last Sunday, my family went to Sloat Blvd. and try the Thai noodle, because I like thai food.
I order Rad Nar  - the bowl very big, but Hardly any other ingredient could be found in these noodle , only little bite pork and few chinese brocoli, and too salty.
My wife order (No. 32 ) Kao Nar Ped, duck just little bite, it is ok, but the soup ver bad and too salty.
My kid order ( N0. 4 ) Guay Tiew Ruer Ruam - it is very bad, the bean sprouts too much, but no more meat, very little, and the soup too sweet too.
I couldn't really like it because it was too salty for me. Don't think we'll be back.
Oh, Cash only.

上週日，我們全家去到Sloat大道。並嘗試泰式麵條，因為我喜歡泰國菜。
我點了Rad Nar ( No.14 )- 碗很大，但幾乎沒有任何其他成分能在這些面被發現，只有量的豬肉和幾條中式西蘭花，湯太鹹. 
我的妻子點了（第32號）Kao Ner Ped，鴨只有小小，它是不錯的，但湯不好，太鹹了。
我的孩子點了（N0.4）Guay Tiew Ruer Ruam - 這是非常糟糕的，豆芽太多，但肉很少和湯太甜了。
我真的不能喜歡它，因為它是太鹹。我們不會回來的。
哦，並且只收現金！
author: Eric W.

description:
This is only a review for their takeout:

I love Thai food, but my tasteless Pad Thai AND Pad See Ew noodles were dry and completely stuck together. I had to slice through clumps of noodles with my fork before I could put them on my plate. Hardly any other ingredient could be found in these noodle dishes other than-- well, noodles-- and a few small pieces of extremely dry chicken strips. 

Like Jenny H. and Hal P., my food had hair in it. I found a short, coarse and curly hair strand floating in my Tom Kha Gai soup that I got To-Go. 

THAT BETTER NOT HAVE BEEN A PUBE.

I could upload a photo, but who wants to see a photo of food with hair in it when they're hungry and browsing restaurants to later dine at? Unless you like pube-like hairs as a garnish in your meals, I suggest you not eat here.
author: Phoebe J.

description:
Popped in here recently for a quick bite.

We ordered Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, Thai Iced Tea and Thai Iced Coffee.

Great food, great service, great prices.

Nice place for casual quick serve Thai.
author: Anthony D.

description:
The food is pretty good at this location, I stick to my usual shrimp pad thai and fried chicken over fried rice which is always good! The pumpkin curry is pretty good here too.

I only have two gripes about this place:

1. They only take cash

2. The last time I was there I ordered the sticky rice with mango and it had an odd smell which was hard to ignore and once we tasted it we found that the coconut milk they had drizzled on top was old, it was disgusting! The sticky rice tasted sour, bitter, and somewhat salty...just a mess! I don't think I will ever order it again from this location.
author: Alejandra I.

description: Pad Thai & Crab Fried Rice are my usual orders here. Very tasty & delicious. Only main gripe is that they're cash only. I'm sure they get this complaint a lot but it's been years and they're STILL cash only. Good friendly service. Decent Thai food for a SF chain Thai restaurant.
author: Amy H.

description: Cash only! Go for the simple options.  The place is quick and friendly.  The bowl of Tom Yum w shrimp was a plentiful and tummy warming lunch.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I'm usually not the one that likes giving 1 star reviews unless it is absolutely terrible, but I strongly feel this place is the worse KoT out of all the other ones.
I came here with a group of people and my friend had curly hair in his rice and there was a sticker on my slice of tomato, not to mention I had soup so the sticker was all soggy and probably mixed in my soup.
Really couldn't finish the rest of my food.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
- cash only
- cheap
- service is eh but fast

1) pad thai - too sweet
2) green curry - yummz and spicy!
3) pad see ew - oily but hits the spot
4) duck fried rice - i thought it was okay, but friends thought it was great. i didn't even realize i was eating duck
author: Margaret R.

description: The food was good, however there is nothing that stands out about this place. Every dish is the same with minor variations. Customer service is great however, the ladies that work there are super nice.
author: Davey H.

description:
It is very likely that the owner who originally started the King of Thai franchise sold his share of this particular restaurant location to the partners which is most likely why the name of this place has changed to The Noodle House.  I'm also assuming they no longer have the same exact standards as King of Thai.  I can only assume from what I ordered the last couple of times this past week.  I noticed a huge difference in the portion of protein vs rice/noodles.  My pad kee mao which is stir fried flat rice noodles with choice of meat, basil, peppers, n sweet soy sauce was more like noodles without the meat or veggies.  I also ordered the basil eggplant with ground pork over rice.  Imagine a larger rock glass you'd normally see at a bar... That was the amount of eggplant, meat, and basil.  Gigi M. was like "Why is there so much rice and so little eggplant?!?!"  4 small pieces of eggplant by the way, while the name of the dish is called "Basil Eggplant".  Ground pork almost nonexistent.  Maybe at most 2 soup spoonfuls or pork to 2 cups of rice.  I added 2 fried eggs and asked them to make sure the yolk isn't over cooked and keep it runny.  Over the phone they said ok not going to be overcooked.  It came out more than fully cooked.  Overall, waaaaay too stingy for my likes.  Didn't know ground meat and eggplant was that costly for them to give the proper portions.

With that said... I'm pretty sure I won't ever be going back unless I absolutely have to.  There are plenty of better locations for solid mediocre and above average thai food like Vanida Thai 2 minutes away on Taraval and 40th or the original King of Thai also on Taraval and 24th.
author: Colin M.

description:
ZERO STARS!

Customer service: 3/5 stars
Food: 0/5 stars
My shrimp was peeled, but the shrimp shells were accidentally thrown into the food and cooked alongside the eggs! So random bites of eggs or noodles would be filled with nasty shrimp shells!! WTF!
author: Ruby K.

description:
This King of Thai isn't nearly as good as its counterparts in the Inner Richmond or TL. I was in the neighborhood with the fiance for Petco and decided to grab my usual (#4) bowl. But the broth was sweet... almost borderline molasses sweet. I only ate half and was very disappointed, as I thought something as dependable as the KOT chain can have such obvious slip-ups like this one.

Don't want to return again. I'll stick to my usual on Clement Street.
author: Jing D.

description: No beers at this location.  Clement and 5th is remodeling now.  My favorite people from that location was at Sloat last night.  Same good ol Thai food!
author: Kevin L.

description:
The Sunset is normally a mecca of great restaurants, but in the middle of the night it becomes difficult to find some late night grub.  I found a Hawaiian BBQ restaurant open (but closing soon) so I hopped in the car and rushed over only to find that they were no longer serving.  Fortunately, there was a King of Thai Noodles in the same plaza so I was in business.

I ordered their chicken Panang curry which was served with rice.  Blended with peanut sauce, this curry was fantastic and was absolutely what I needed to cure my hunger pangs.  I am not normally accustomed to having peanut sauce in the curry, but it proved to be a great combination that I will have to try to recreate in my own kitchen.

I am a bonafide fan of King of Thai Noodles restaurants, especially now.  I was so relieved that they were even open that I even tipped extra for that convenience.  It's no wonder that they are so successful seeing as though they have an awesome balance of great food, low prices, superb convenience, and warm service.  It's a great concept that I think other restaurants can really learn from and I only wish that I had one of these in San Diego.  Fortunately for me, I can make everything that they can, perhaps even better!

Food: 9/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
It's a hit or miss with this place. 

One day you'll get one of the best tasting pad thai,  the next day it's bland as hell. ..

They did however took care of me when I complained about how bland it was. 

I just wish consistency is part of their business motto...
author: Hong L.

description:
Came here after my first dragon boat practice at Lake Merced.  Seems to be a popular spot for lunch after the cold waters for most paddlers on Saturdays.  The waitresses at first seemed kind of confused after we told them that the group we were in was not part of the soon-to-be-20-person group that came in before us, but they figured it out...eventually.

Being newly moved from Hawaii, of course I wanted to order a piping hot and spicy soup.  I loooove hot and sour soup, so I went for the Tom Young Goong.  They cooked it up pretty fast, since I waited about five minutes.

The soup was average - good level of spiciness and flavor, with a decent amount of shrimp: a whole six pieces!...at least they deveined it.  I thought it was a little too sour, and it was kind of skimpy with the proportion of soup fillings (two tomato halves and like three mushrooms sliced up? please...) and I ended up with a crapton more of soup than expected since they served it to me in this huge bowl.  For the price, $7.75, I think it wasn't worth it, but at least my tummy was warm and I wasn't freezing, which was the most important part! =)
author: Dianna D.

description: Just grabbed lunch here, ordered the beef stew noodle (#3) and pad sa eww. Both lacked flavor.
author: Julie C.

description:
Better than the standard fare around Stonestown Galleria and lots healthier. But the Chicken Pad Bee Law [stir fried flat (chow fun) rice noodles and with egg, Chinese broccoli in sweet black soy sauce] had little flavor without the table condiments to assist.

We also tried the Kao Pad Gai Tod [deep fried boneless chicken breast over fried rice with egg , white onion, tomatoes, topped with cilantro and cucumber, and served with sweet chili sauce]. This was OK but it could have been much better, with more seasonings. It actually had everything listed, but somehow it came out not the complex Thai flavors as we'd hoped.

The service was very attentive and quick but not particularly personable. All in all, not bad.
author: Glenn H.

description:
this is my go-to place for thai food! fast, consistent, and delicious! It's a simple thai restaurant, plain lavender decor, no random orchid on your plate- just yummy thai ready to dive in my belly.

Pad-thai w/ chicken or shrimp (or both!)- super delicious! 

Pad see mao- delicious and spicy! they are a bit inconsistent with the amt of spice they use each time but you'll be able to handle it if you love spicy food!

tom yum soup with rice noodles- AH- my current favorite thai dish. perfect order for a chilly sf night! 

pros:
quick (typically no wait-time and served fast-enough, it's borderline fast food), food's delicious!, cheap

cons
cash only (but bofa atm in the luckys next door)
author: Patricia K.

description:
I have never met a pad thai I haven't loved!

'Til now.

I ordered through grubhub and the food arrived quickly, a plus. But the Woon Sen pad thai was just one giant lump of rice noodles, with a few whole shrimp and some burnt, dried-out tofu hanging out over a lot of bean sprouts. There was nothing to pull this dish together.

The poh pier tod - an eggroll-type offering - had some unidentifiable mushy stuff at its base. The pad ma keur - eggplant with vegetables - was good, but had that same dried-out tofu. Moreover, there was hardly enough of it to justify the $8.45 price tag.

Can anyone recommend a Thai restaurant that delivers near Park Merced?
author: Booklover F.

description: My husband and I love this place as it reminds us of when we first moved to the area (when we were broke college grads). It's nothing fancy, but it has always been affordable and consistently serves fresh and tasty food. Great service too! Went there again a couple of weeks ago and noticed it changed names... I'm not sure if it changed ownership or not, but other than the fact that they now accept cards, made new menus and redecorated a bit, things are basically the same.
author: Tatiane R.

description:
yummy ground chicken with basil and serrano chilis.
wow, i was super starving but this hit the spot like a pau gasol no look bounce pass to a cutting kobe bryant!
wonderful flavors.
clean environment.
pleasant service.
and FREE wi-fi coverage from the tully's coffee house next door.
what more do you need on a rainy wednesday afternoon?
JYW eats here!
author: Jeff W.

description:
I went here way back when I visited Nubi Yogurt in the same shopping center and this place is another favorite of mine when I lived in the area. I remember I would always have to visit the BofA ATM in the Lucky's next door to get a 20 out for lunch or dinner as this place is CASH ONLY!

This visit I got the pumpkin curry with some Thai hot tea. It was pretty good....had some good heat to it, until the heat kinda snuck up on me and I was crying uncle by the end of my meal. I thought to myself, "This pumpkin is pretty good," though, within further inspection, I soon realized that my "pumpkin" curry was pumpkin SQUASH curry. No biggie to me. I still enjoyed it.

Overall, a decent spot for Thai. They also have pretty good soups there from the last few times I've tried it in the past.
author: Grace L.

description: I love love King of Thai Noodle! One of my favorite restaurant in the city. Yes, they are all over the city like a chain restaurant, but the food is awesome! Of course, I preferred the one on Taraval, the original King of Thia, but this location has the $18 menu where you get three entrees for $18! And, it's in the Lakeshore Plaze where parking is easy to find.
author: Cindy C.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 4 Stars
Average: 3.75 Stars

+ Fast Service
+ Open Late

- Cash Only

[W] Good thing about most of the King of Thai restaurants is that they usually close late. Downside is that they're usually cash only as well! This time I wanted to try something new on the menu other than the normal pad thai, pad see lew, or rad nar, or their curries. I had a rice dish which I think was #48 that had eggplant and pork. I'm glad I changed it up because it tasted pretty good! Now I can add another dish onto my list if I ever had an appetite for something other than the "norm." People usually order what they're comfortable with or what they recognize BUT I advise everyone to try something new sometime because it could actually turn out to be a good experience. 

[M] I was craving for Tom Kha (Chicken Soup with Coconut Milk) but they don't offer this on their menu so I went safe and stuck with my usual Woon Sen Pad Thai (glass noodles). I don't normally touch the raw bean sprouts on the side so I wish they would have taken them out and give me more noodles instead hehe. My Pad Thai was good as usual.

[W] Parking here never seems to be an issue because this restaurant is located in an outdoor mall. Food is good and service is fast so that's always a plus.
author: Mona C.

description: I have been going here for years and the food has always been pretty good. The proportions however have been declining through the years, but noted the prices have not risen that much too. I can say overall it is a great place to dine and get to go.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
I usually come here when I don't feel like going all the way to the Taraval location. It's much smaller and is cash only, although the menu is the same.

I'm giving it two stars because it really doesn't hold up to the other locations I've been to. The Thai iced tea was overly sweet, and I got a bite of my Tom yum gai that tasted like mold (just one bite, but it was enough to put me off). Yuck.
author: Rachel A.

description:
This place has ok food. I ordered the chicken w basil. They don't put enough basil in it. 
I was there w my boyfriend and they brought out his food fast. But I saw them give my order to another table that came in after us, and they got all there food before I got mine. I assume someone at the table ordered the same dish as I did. So my bf was practically done w his food when they finally brought out my dish. No more then five 5, YES FIVE MINUTES after I got my food they asked if we were done and wanted to box up our food. Most likely they asked Cuz he was just still there on his phone. I was like sure. I dident want to sit there any longer w the oblivious servers. I took my food and finished at home. Grrrr.
author: mikayla m.

description:
Best thing on the menu: $18 3 entree dine-in dinner :)

Worth your money for just a quick meal but filling as well. I usually share the meal with 4-5 girls so it's just enough after a long day or anything. The place is pretty small but it is clean. Also not a lot of people so no way. 

In all, a 3 because of the small space and semi-poor service but altogether cheap food!
author: Kary Y.

description:
Good, quick, and filling Thai food. How many Thai restaurants can you say about that?

This King of Thai on Sloat boulevard is much better than the one on Taraval, in my opinion. They give you bigger portions for the same prices, the atmosphere is much brighter so it doesn't feel like you're eating in a cave, and they have neat daily discount deals for everyday of the week on most frequent bought items!

+Monday-Tuesday: Buy 3 items and receive a free order of fried vegetarian egg rolls. (We got to try this; very good)
+Wednesday: $1 off Pad See Iew
+Thursday: $1 off Fried Chicken over Fried Rice
+Friday-Sunday: Free Thai Iced Tea or Thai Iced Coffee(per person) with the purchase of your meal

*Note: this place accepts CASH ONLY as does the Taraval King of Thai
author: Benson T.

description:
There have been many occasions where my buddies and I can't decide on where to eat for dinner. A lot of those times, I ended up coming here since I can't go wrong with what I am already familiar with. 

King of That Noodle in sloat is clean and the employees are very friendly. So good service and cleanliness is a bonus, now moving on to the food. I recommend the 3 item special for only $18! You can choose 3 of any of the dishes on the list and they all can be entrees! Usually I order the Kao Pad, which had fried chicken strips with fried rice and Thai chili sauce. 

Of all the times I came here, I end up satisfied and their pricing is very fair, especially for young college students like myself. 

If you live around San Francisco State University and ponder where to eat out at, definitely give this place a try.
author: Victor Q.

description: Place is called The Noodle House. Bought take out and food was okay when eaten at home. Parking is a little tight in this mini shopping center after work. CASH ONLY.
author: Clifford W.

description:
I couldn't think of what is open at almost 10PM. Ono closes at 9 or 9:30. 

After class I was hungry. I was contemplating going to Domino's for pizza since they have a deal going on this week, but decided on King of Thai. I had my cash (cash only) & was ready to go. The sign said they were open but they didn't have any more customers inside, so I asked if they were open & they were. I quickly ordered since I'm sure all the workers wanted to go home.

I decided on #38 green curry w/ rice. I have no idea what it's called, just look in the curry section. I've had this exact dish once before and split it with a friend. We ordered several dishes that time, but this was the only one I could remember. I didn't remember it was so spicy, I remember it was spicy but not that spicy. It probably isn't spicy, only to me.

Maybe I wasn't hungry today, actually I was but I still have half a container of curry & no rice left. I guess I'll have to add more rice into the curry. For under $8, I have enough curry for 2 meals but not enough rice.
author: Kylie L.

description:
CASH ONLY like every other asian restaurant in sf/dc.  So annoying, but when I have cash in my pants I do take-out at King of Thai.

I usually order the chicken/seafood coconut soup, shrimp pad thai or beef pad see ew, with a thai ice tea.

Quick and friendly service. Food is great. Their Taraval location is better for dine-in.
author: Jenny G.

description:
Is king of thai. Dont expect much. usually just order the fried rice with thai ice tea. no complaints about this place. thai chain with decent food for the price. dont expect anything too "authentic"
very friendly service, not in a rush to kick you out compared to other establishments like chinese restaurants.

always willing to go back to any of their restaurants if i dont have any options or dont want to think for dinner.
author: Andi I.

description:
My dragonboat team comes here at least once a week after our practices at lake merced. After a grueling morning or evening of water practice, thai food and noodle soup seems to be the agreed upon cure. 

This past week we came with around 20 people, or normal amount. The staff was really nice and were able to accommodate us by putting tables together. What I like most about King of Thai is that not only do they have a variety of soup combinations and ingredients, but they give you choices between noodles! Egg, wide rice, small round rice, and vermicilli noodles-simply because some days I like my #7 with vermicilli normally, but somedays I feel like wide rice! Anyways, so as per usual I ordered a #7, which came with ground pork, fish cakes, fish balls, some beef slices in a tom yum broth-yeah, amazing combination for noodle soup. 

After a few moments our food started to come out- and it started to come out fast. It seemed as if once the staff dropped off a plate/bowl they went back they immediately came out to bring more dishes out. When about 75% of our food was out, dishes stopped coming out. Of course we told those that got their food to start eating, but when people had started finishing their dishes we noticed lots of time had passed since food had come out. We asked the staff what was was going on, had they forgotten or orders? One of the waitresses came out a few minutes later with the following news: "I'm sorry, we ran out of those bowls" while pointing at a noodle soup someone was eating. Those of us who ordered any noodle soup, including me simply stared and surprisingly in unison asked something close to "Why didn't you tell us before?!" Then we asked about the people who ordered normal dishes like their pad thai (which is delicious by the way) and her eyes widened and she told us she'd be right back. 

In the end, we all got the dishes we ordered, but apparently only after people had finished the bowls necessary to serve our respective dishes. Apparently this rarely happens she said, but the fact that it could happen at all surprised all of us. Having come by many times before, it was a good thing we all knew this place was a great restaurant to get cheap and deliciously filling thai food. 

If you're looking for a quick place to eat while you're in the area and your group is much less than 20 people, definitely check this place out, it's definitely an answer to the "where should we eat" question-something I ask all too often =D. Sort of random, but those on the Paleo diet, their eggplant chicken stir fry fits your diet regiment and is actually really well seasoned and cooked and tastes delicious!

*Note-there is no longer complimentary thai iced tea and the restaurant only takes cash!
author: Jon K.

description:
A friend of mine told me about the 3/$18 eat in special. Told my usual eating partner and we found ourselves at King of Thai on Sloat on a weekday.

First things first, I didn't know there was a short list of things you could choose from for the 3/$18. S.H.O.R.T! Then to top it off one of the meals we chose, the waiter told us they ran out?!?! You've been open for 2 hours at most and you're already OUT??? So we ordered something else from the short list and what a disappointment. I don't even remember what it was, chicken something or other. We also ordered the Pad Thai, noodles were thinner than we're used to and it was sweeter than we're used to. Surprisingly there was plenty of shrimp in it. We also ordered the beef green curry. Nice flavor, plenty of veggies and meat, but the beef was so thin and tough. Must remember NOT to order beef at Thai restos anymore unless it's ground beef. 3/$18 is worth it if you're sharing. The deal is only available for eat in only.

Still on the lookout for a good Thai resto......
author: Dina V.

description: I would've loved to give this spot 4 stars but, I didn't leave satisfied. The portion was really small for the price, and I left still hungry. The service was great , food came quickly.
author: Amai M.

description:
I really only go here for the noodle soup, so I am pretty much only reviewing that. The broth is delicious but the meat is very tough. I have tried different types to no avail. 
They only have 3 appetizers.
author: Hannah K.

description:
