I love Thai food and don't get me wrong, some king of thai places are not bad and are delicious such as the ones on Clement street and the one in North Beach. However, today I decided to eat my lunch here and the following things happened.

- Never got my water and was never checked up on.
- Received a dollar in change in dimes only.

The food was mediocre, but I've had way better Thai food elsewhere. Oh, and after a hour later, my lips felt really dry and I was really thirsty. I believe this is a sign of MSG! because I never get thirsty! the only times I get thirsty is after working out a lot and I didn't work out at all today.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
Completely awful experience. I came here with about 20 people from my dragon boat team after practice. We were tired, cold and hungry and thai noodle soup sounded incredibly delicious and warm.

The staff was very nice and accommodating for our large group. They put a couple of tables together to seat 10 at each. The menu also had a lot of variety (as most Thai places do). The noodles give you a choice of choosing a different type of noodle with your order - egg, wide rice, small rice or vermicilli. I ordered a #5 with egg noodles which was with pork as the main meat. Sounded delicious!

As food started coming out for some of my friends... and more food... I sat there with my empty spot. 45 minutes in while everyone was already FINISHING up with their food... some of us still hadn't gotten ours. I asked one of the staff what was up and he went back to go check. Some time later, a waitress comes out and tell us that they RAN OUT OF BOWLS. Seriously?! They asked us to reorder our food ... (and I also watched as one of the waitresses brought out a BOWL OF NOODLES to another customer that sat down MUCH AFTER we had). 

Ran out of bowls, huh?! Still... how do you run out of bowls in a restaurant...

I was already fed up with the waiting and how hungry I was that I just told them to order me a pad thai. The pad thai came out after about 5-10 minutes and by that time ... most were already finished and just waiting for us to eat. I mean they did compensate by giving us a iced tea (which actually only costs a dollar). The pad thai was alright, wasn't the best thing I had since it looked like they quickly threw it together. I wanted my egg noodles!!!

-1 for waiting for roughly 1 hr for food
-1 for running out of bowls
-1 for having to reorder after waiting
author: Angela K.

description:
This place is NEVER consistent with taste...which leads me right into my experience tonight. I placed an order for 2 pad thai's (one without bean sprouts) and 1 pad kee maw. 

OMFG the pad kee maw tasted like pure thai chili. It was so spicy that it was bitter...so spicy that I wanted to rip my tongue off!! It never used to taste like that. It used to be spicy but spicy enough that I could handle it. 

The pad thai was still how I remembered it to be...good. Though, I would like a little bit more lime. 

My sister called ahead to place the order and the lady said 20mins. I got there in 15 and still had to wait an additional 10mins.
author: Serena F.

description:
If I could check in from far away, I'd have triple the check-ins I have now. My pops picks this up for me on his way home so I get to-go very often.

I just had a bowl of tom yum soup tonight and wow, amazing! The right amount of spicy and sour flavors kick into my mouth at once. I think they switched their cooks from the Clement St. location to this one because I usually visit the Clement one since I tasted better but lately it's been MEH so I've been visiting this location much more. Splendid because this is the location closest to my house! And trust me, I've been to every single King of Thai in the city. I still need to Yelp all of them. ....Don't judge me.. haha
author: Vikki K.

description: CASH ONLY!  Now that's thats out of the way, let me tell you about the amazing crab fried rice, fried rice with duck, the different curries they offer, and of course the tom yum soup.  There really isn't anything bad on the menu, in fact, all the dishes are really good.  The restaurant is decent sized, and the parking lot is kinda small but it's well worth the trip.  You can park on the other side where the lot is huge because there's a Luckys store around the corner and when you're done, you can walk off all those rich calories you just threw down, haha.  But if you're down for authentic thai food with actual thai waitresses, and wash down a good meal with a refreshing thai iced tea, this is your spot.
author: Myke Y.

description: I love coming here. The staff here treat you like family. The food is as always GREAT. I coming here at least twice a week just to get their Thai Ice Tea. Keep up the excellent service!!!
author: Dimple P.

description:
I went here because I friend recommended it to me. I really liked the Pad Thai, it was my favorite dish that I order! I however was not too happy with my other dish ( eggplant dish). I gave it 3 stars because they tried to charge me extra because I just wanted veggies in my eggplant dish. although it clear states in the menu that it will be just 7.95 ( don't remember the price exactly) and 8.95 for meat. Anyways the place is okay maybe I just got a bad waiter. But ill try it again. 

just beware in what they are charging you.
author: Desiree T.

description:
The Rule of Three, which states things that come in threes are inherently funnier, more satisfying, or more effective than other numbers of things (Wikipedia!), applies to this King of Thai.  KOT's 3 for $18 menu special elevates it to King of King of Thais.  Before any skepticism sets in, let me assure you that everything you would normally consider ordering is on this menu.

The boneless fried chicken over fried rice provides the largest portions and greatest satisfaction.  When the crispy skin, juicy meat, and flavorful fried rice are drenched in sauce, each bite produces an accompanying grunt of content.

The service at KOT is also top notch - never will your cup of water even remain half-empty for long and requests for additional sauce are quickly honored.  

Grab 2 friends, or 5, or 8...you get the idea, and enjoy the cheap, delicious eats here!
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is not like the other restaurants. My associates have told me they gotten food poisoning from this spot. 

I decided to give them a try them .thinking they may have changed.Chicken tasted kinda of off ( i  will make another review if i get sick) Service definitely sucks!
author: Dreea R.

description: I always enjoy King of Thai restaurants. This one has a good combo deal. But keep in mind they only take cash! Service is fast people are cool, food is good. I do like the Union Square better, but it's definitely has more traffic,
author: Marie P.

description: The curry I ordered was watered down and bland tasting. This is the first time I've ever eaten there And I don't know if I'll order from there anymore.
author: Emily H.

description:
I love King Of Thai!! Of course, I went to Thailand in October/2008 so there's no comparison, but this place rocks!! 

Their beef flat noodle is great too!! 

It's spelled & pronounced Pad See Ew...but they wrote on the menu Pad See Lew. 

I don't care...that's how I'm going to pronounce it from now on. You'll understand the joke if you understand Cantonese. 

Fried Chicken Over Fried Rice 
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/MihVo3lxvnsrHvzW4CzJBw/l 

(Sunday, January 18, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
came here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. the service here is decent and prices are good - definitely on the cheaper side for Thai food. I guess the only drawback is the food is whatevers. I ordered the Yellow Curry which was pretty bland. I had to add some sauces/chili pepper flakes to make it tastier. 

meh .
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Out of all the King of Thais in the city, this has got to be my least fave.  Overall food is okay but the workers here are so, mean mugging, stare you down, stingy with their hot suace-ish.

The very first time I came here was a couple years back.  Came in with a friend to grab some lunch TO GO, place was dead so it didn't take too long for the order to come. We decided to take a couple of bites before heading out and since there was no one in there we didn't think the workers would mind. Oh no no, the two workers just kept snickering and looking at us, it was SO uncomfortable. We both gave each other the oh haleee no face.    I know, I know, maybe they're not talking about us right? Then dang, did they have to LOOK like they were?  As if they were mad that we said TO GO but ate a few forks full there. 


I don't know why I keep coming back, maybe because it's the closest one to me and I pray I don't see the same workers.  Another thing I don't like is that when you ask for a small container for the sriracha sauce, they tell you they'll give you this packaged one which is a completely different kind of chilly sauce! What the?!  This has happened more than once already too and I tried telling the workers that it's different but get "No it's the same, yeh, the same the same".  How am I suppose to eat my Pad See Ew (w/ beef of course) without the proper cock sauce?!
author: Annie C.

description:
Just like any other King of Thai, but much like the one on Clement Street because this place is tiny. They pack as many tables together as possible in a small space. When there are non-Asians, sitting behind your chair, it is impossible to get out. 

During their grand opening they didn't give the special discount rate as posted..
author: M C.

description:
Cash only.  If you forgot then run over to Luckys and use their ATM.

Another King of Thai to review.  You'd think they all would taste similar and you're right, they do.  

I always get the pad see ew and the fried rice with the fried chicken on top.  This last time I got the fried tofu and I probably won't get it again.  Totally flavorless.  The only variation I seem to notice amongst the different locations are the portion size and the staff.

Portion size at this location is plentiful.  Staff was friendly but rough around the edges.  You can't really expect anymore.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
This King of Thai!!! in particular is different not so much as their food is better nor worse then other King of Thais.

BUT the fact that they have a really good lunch special where you can get 3 entrees for around $18 its on special lunch menu which has most of everyone's go to favorites like pad thai and types of curry and etc... 

Service is ehhh depending on who's working, last few times I've been the ppl that have been working were on the boarder line rude in my opinion.
author: Matt F.

description:
Not happy at all that they did not disclose the fact it is no long King of Thai until I arrived and then they said cash only but that was just a very small part of this story. 
I ordered the duck noodle soup with extra garlic in addition to string beans with ground chicken. Not only did the duck soup taste bland but there were bits of bone in it. I believe the cooks chopped garlic without properly cleaning the area but when I told the owner, he just said we would not do that. We buy our garlic from the restaurant depot. I asked him if there were a possibility in what I was stating and he said no. 
The string beans were edible at best but at least had no bone. 
It would have been much easier to just tell the truth or at least find out from the kitchen if things were indeed not correct. 
When I say that I will never go to this restaurant again, I mean it but hope that others who may be adventurous enough to try it will be careful.
author: Ed N.

description:
I love this place !
Food are Delicious n good service! 
This is one of my favorite places!!
I love Lunch special 3/$-20 menu
Love Pad Tai n yellow curry!!
author: Sabrina H.

description:
I've only had take out and it's fast, i get there and it's ready. The staff is super
friendly, the kind that you wanna tip, even for just picking up. I love anything with duck and the fried rice i got last night was off da chain, just mix in some chili sauce. The fried chicken over fried rice is huge and the #17 noodles with shrimp is fantastic. This is my new spot!!
author: april p.

description:
Been here once in my life, I'm usually on the Taraval side, but I was here to meet up with my girls for our casual girls only date night. 

I have to say that service could smile a little more but their food is excellent as expected. Their pad thai has to be one of my favorites, one of the best I've had so far bc it has more flavor and actually saucy. Most places serve their pad thai a little dry so I loved their sauciness. Their pad thai is a must try and I couldn't leave with out having one of their thai iced teas; oh so sweet just that way I love it :)

A definitely must go to again.

Private parking lot available and it doesn't hurt that it's located right inside a mini shopping center.
author: Anonymous P.

description: blah. totally bland. I've eaten here 3 times now and that's definitely enough. no more. not at all the flavorful experience that Thai food should be.
author: Jesse N.

description: I have a love hate relationship with this King of Thai, not because of the food, but rather the relatively snobby servers who tend to skimp on the water by packing extra ice or not refilling until I am done eating. It's always a mystery coming in as to who's serving. Sometimes customer service is excellent and my glass is always full, other times service is just slow and I don't get a refill of water until my mouth is on fire from the spice I added in my order. Nevertheless, King of Thai never disappoints me food wise. I love the Kao Pad with the fried chicken breast, which is my usual if I'm not in the mood for noodles or curry. Otherwise, I get the pad kee mao or the pad see lew and both are delicious. I especially like how every King of Thai allows for the customization of the flavor with the variety of condiments laid out on the table.
author: May D.

description: First of all the place is no longer King of Thai. They changed their name to Noodle House.  I was really in the mood for Pad Thai and I was in the area. The sign said opens at 10:30 am. I waited until 10:30 and then opened the door. It was unlocked so I went in to order. One of the cooks looked annoyed and told me the person who takes orders would arrive in about 10 minutes. I mentioned that the sign says open at 10:30.  He repeated 10 minutes. I said I was open to waiting and took a seat where the waiting seats are. I waited a good 20 minutes with the other cooks giving me dirty looks. I gave up and left for a real King of Thai on Taraval (my usual go to place for Pad Thai). I've been here before. Food is the same as King of Thai. But they suck for being cash only and not following their posted business hours and for the dirty looks. I won't be returning.
author: Yolanda C.

description: I love their boneless chicken and fried rice dish. I always ask for extra sauce. In addition, I enjoy their thai ice tea. Their service is decent. Cheers!
author: Gina Y.

description:
Convenient location from my house and from practice.

Cash only, fast, decent food.
Usual orders:
Duck fried rice
#23 with beef
Boneless chicken over fried rice
Pad See Iew with beef
Green Curry w/ chicken
author: Stefanie S.

description: I have been here plenty of times but this time, the food was not good. I ordered the chicken fried rice and the rice was watery and mushy. The chicken also had this weird after taste that was a bit nauseating. I guess I should have asked them to remake it but at that point, I just wanted to leave. Despite my unpleasant meal, the server was really nice and attentive and packed my left overs for me.
author: Brigitte M.

description: Not super feeling it. The gang karee curry kind of looked like vomit. However, it did pass the taste test. However, the chicken they used was the store bought used in salads and I could tell they did not put too much effort in the dish.
author: Nneka O.

description: I love this place but cant give a 5 star because they started skimping my lunch meal. I order here at least once every two weeks and it gets less and less.
author: John M.

description: Blah.. we ordered satay chicken.. it was mushy taste like skewers of cumin with curry and chicken fried rice.. now that had no thai taste at all!!!  It taste like garlicky mushy rice with boiled chicken.  And the peanut sauce had barely a peanut flavor, tasted vinagery with a slight peanut butter flavor.  Oh and CASH ONLY!! :(
author: Family H.

description:
Everytime I come here, the service is speedy and not once have I felt neglected or dissed n' pissed.  Usually go with the BF and we order the same damn thing every time - he gets the fried rice with crispy chicken strips, no tomatoes or onions, and I get the chicken fried rice with no tomatoes and a CRAP LOAD of that spicy red hawt juice/sauce.  If the portions aren't filling enough, (for me, 1 dish is enuf) I'd suggest getting the pad see ew with fried rice or curry rice; very good.  

Sometimes the communication with the waitress/waiter is difficult but a little patience goes a long way.  I don't think they intentionally try to be rude or not understand simple instructions/requests...it does get a little frustrating but I won't hold it against them.  Service - good.  Food - satisfying.  Price - Fair.  Location - convenient.  I am - awesome.
author: Kat C.

description:
First of all I want to say that the one on Taravel was good, so when i came here I had some expectations. I usually just get the Pad Thai which came quite slow even though they weren't busy. When i stuck my fork in my food, it was basically a lump of noodles i had to cut my way through it. Also there were about 3 or 4 shrimp in my food which was disappointing and barely any egg. 
So overall, I was pretty disappointed I don't think I ever want to come to this location or any to be quite honest.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I've had food from this particular Thai restaurant a few times now.  I've eaten at the location and have had their take out.  I can confidently say I like this place a lot.  Apparently, there's several "King of Thai" restaurants scattered all over San Francisco, but this is the first one I have ever tried.  

From the outside, it doesn't look like much. Once inside though, you'll be surprised to see it is pretty spacious.  The place is kept clean also, considering the high amount of business they have, though much of the business appears to be from take out.  The menu has a decent variety.  

With the name "noodle soup" in its title, I've tried the noodle soup and found it average.  Most of the good stuff are everything else on the menu.  The appetizers are good to try, but I'd advise just going straight to the entrees because they are almost the same price, unless you are really aching for them.  The yellow curry which my girlfriend likes is really good.  I could just pour the curry sauce onto the white rice and just eat it like that.  The Gal Pad Med Mamuang (sauteed chicken, cashew nuts bell pepper, white onion and dry chili with thai chili paste and sweet black soy sauce) is probably one of the things I order the most.  The Pad Thai, the staple of all Thai food, has nothing spectacular but is pretty good there.  

As everyone on previous reviews have said already.  Prepare to pay in cash because that's all they take.  I know that sucks, but they make up for it in speed and quality that comes with that speed.  This place isn't the pinnacle of Thai food, and if I were giving it a rating for the food specifically; I'd give it a 3.5 or to be more exact a 3.7.  The food is good, just not the best.  What gives King of Thai on Sloat the extra boost to four stars is: the take out is fast and convient, they have free delivery (if you purchase twenty or thirty bucks worth of stuff), and it's opened later.
author: Arnold T.

description:
***Warning they only accept cash.

My date and I were decided to stop in and give it a shot, and it turned out to be an okay place. The food was good and the service was ok.

My only complaint..... they only accept cash.
author: Saint S.

description:
Compared to other King of Thai locations that I've tried, the food quality is inconsistent here.

The first experience: the veggie noodle soup was generous and diverse in veggies, like other King of Thais, but it was barely salty.

The second experience: the veggie fried rice had rice that wasn't cooked enough.

The location's great, though, so I'll probably continue going here, and will update this review accordingly...
author: George K.

description: this location offers delivery on any orders over $15 now!! that's awesome! it took them less than 30 minutes and the food was still piping hot. they even deliver thai iced tea!! heads up though... CASH ONLY!
author: Ann T.

description:
Ok.. so I love this place. I've been here many times for lunch. I also love the 3/$18 special menu. I love that the list is short and sweet because too many options can be annoying when your hungry. We usually order  pad tai with tofu, the yellow curry with chicken and the house fried rice with chicken on top. I forget what its called and yes we love chicken.

The portions are enough for the three of us and for the price, its perfect. I come here time and time again. They make thai the way I like it. If it's commercial...I don't know better.

Side note: I went to a fancy thai restaurant last night in San Rafael and it wasn't nearly as good and cheap as Thai King!!!

The only caveat I have about this place is that it is small and we have to wait for a table. This happens more than not. AND it's CASH ONLY!! We live in a plastic world. Who carries cash anymore?

Love,

D
author: Denise C.

description:
All of my friends love this place, but I think its garbage.

You may like this restaurant if you have not experienced REAL Thai food, or at least GOOD Thai food. I have been to this restaurant multiple times, and after the first 4 times I gave up on convincing myself I like it. The only reason I keep returning is because I'd be with a group of friends.

My friends love their Pad Thai, but I think it's disgusting. You can buy instant Pad Thai at a grocery store for equivalent taste.

Usually when I go to Thai restaurants I order Drunken Noodles, and when I asked the waiter if they make it (because I didn't see it on the menu) he didn't know what I was talking about. But another worker did know what I was talking about, and told me to order Pad Ki Mao. I love Thai food for the many flavors and spices its known for; this dish was extremely bland and tasted like Chinese Chow Fun. 

I did have one good experience though, I actually liked their Pumpkin Curry.

I have been to MANY Thai restaurants, and one thing I have always noticed is how super friendly the staff always is. However, the workers here are actually kind of rude. I understand that one time we hadn't finished eating yet when they were trying to close and they were unhappy, but they were extremely unprofessional. I have worked at a restaurant before and know how irritating it is to have to close late, but I know the importance of respecting customers!

You may disagree with my review, but keep in mind that Thai food is one of my absolute favorites, and I am REALLY picky about it!

I am new to San Francisco, so please let me know if you know of a good Thai restaurant!!
author: Kayla I.

description: I finally talked to the boss about the beef broth.  He did acknowledge that they no longer add the "blood" to the broth, because their "customers do not like it".  What a shame!  The soup really, really, suffers.  I just don't order the soup here anymore.  I go to the Clement original location now.  Yes, CLEMENT KOTN still does the beef broth right.  Minus one star.
author: Stephen F.

description:
I don't know why I came back to this place twice! I wanted to give this place another try b/c King of Thai is everywhere, but I just don't like this one. 

The pad thai noodles here was skinny rice noodles and are always mushy and lacking in tofu and shrimp.

The Duck fried rice is crappy too. They give you the parts with either very little meat and all bone or the very fatty parts. Gross.
author: Ivy L.

description:
Affordable good food! We placed a to go order. When we arrived the gal at the counter greeted me with a friendly smile. 

We ordered:
#15 Pad See Lew (flat noodles with chicken and Chinese broccoli)-my favorite
#19 Kao Pad (fried rice with duck and we added Chinese sausage $2 extra)
#27 Som Tum (papaya salad)-ask for the dressing on the side otherwise it will be drenched in dressing
#28 Satay Gai (chicken skewers)-loved the peanut sauce
#29 Poh Pier Tod (egg rolls)
#30 Tod Mun (fish cake)

Everything was good except for the eggrolls. For some reason it tasted gross this time. Maybe it was a bad batch. We've also tried other dishes before...#18 Pad Thai, #31 fried chicken over fried rice, #32 roast duck over rice...all was delicious. 

They deliver...$15 minimum.
author: Jo S.

description: I've been going here for years... so sad to discover today that it's changed hands. I ordered my usual dish and it tasted so bland I could hardly finish it. Portions are smaller and prices are higher. Sad to see the old King of Noodle at this location go...
author: Les L.

description:
You can tell when I am having a good time eating spicy food is when I develop sweat on my nose. The food heat is good and fast , staff is attentive and friendly. The place is on the side of Albertsons/Luckys    
Parking is not the easiest to find if you have a large SUV. but if you have a small car or cycle it's just great. The food was intensely flavorful and not to spicy where all you can taste is heat. The only bad thing I can say is that they didn't have desert. oh well you can't have it all. Fast quick and Tasty. (cheap too)
author: Jesse S.

description:
To be completely honest, this place is basically a standby for decent, cheap food. I love Thai food, and this place is pretty mediocre, but it is cheap, and it gets the job done.

Went to this particular King of Thai last Wednesday with my girlfriend because they have special on right now. There's a one page special menu inside the menu, and on this page it says "Select any three items for $18." Pretty good deal. Got the fried chicken over fried rice, roast pork and Chinese sausage, and Pad Kee Mao.

Definitely hit the spot. The cash only thing does kinda suck, but when you get three things for less than $20 so it's totally worth the price.
author: Tonichi L.

description: I am almost here every Thursday :) good costumer service and above all my favorite is no. 33. I forgot what it's called hahah!!! I order it with brown rice!!!! The best! I can eat this everyday but have to exercise more!!!! Please try no. 33::):) it's basically rice with chorizo, onions and some sauce !!!! I will check the name next time so I can add it here!!!! :)
author: Loraine C.

description:
This was my second time having dinner at King of Thai Noodle House. The first time, my boyfriend and I ordered noodle soups which were pretty tasty, but didn't leave such an large impact on us to rush back again. 

The restaurant is a small, cozy size with tables close together. There is a little bar where customers hang out to wait for their take out. The service is good and the servers are friendly. We ordered two dishes, the Gang Greree, which is Thai yellow curry with white onion, potatoes, served with cucumber salad, and Gai Pad Med Ma Muang, sauteed chicken, cashew nuts bell pepper, white onion and dry chili with Thai chili paste and sweet black soy sauce, and served with steamed rice.

At first glance, the portion did not seem very large to me, especially the yellow curry. However, as we started eating, I was surprised by how much chicken there was in these dishes. It seemed endless to me as I kept scooping food into our plates. In the end we had to push ourselves a little to finish. The dishes were both a little spicy and had a lot of flavor in them.  

All in all, I had a good experience and wouldn't mind going back.
author: Doris W.

description:
Yes please!~ This is a great place to grab a quick meal as I have been here several times and, as the previous reviewer noted, reasonably priced for sure.

My favorite location is still the one nearest to Union Square, however this location really doesn't fall far behind because the food tastes great regardless. Their flavors are on target and their service is friendly. Especially good for take out because parking is a pain!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Thai fast food...that's what it is.  It's a go-to place when you need a quick Thai fix dine-in or take-out.

I usually get the eggplant over rice, sliced duck w/flat rice noodle, or the stir fried flat rice noodle w/beef & soy sauce.  Their crab fried rice is pretty good too.

Staff is always friendly and quick!...o yeh...it's Thai fast food.  

Parking is easy in it's lot.  This place is cash only...so bring the Washington's cuz it is reasonably priced as well.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Ever since I was born, SF has been my second home.  I've heard a lot about the King of Thai franchise over the years, but never ate at one of their locations.  Finally, I decided to try it out.  My bf has been going to several of their locations for years, claiming it was his go to drunken food after going clubbing (when their locations would open til the wee house of the morning).  

He got the fried chicken breast over fried rice (his usual).  And I got the very un-Thai dish of roast pork with Chinese sausage & fried rice.  Both were pretty tasty, though the roast pork is usually moister at Chinese delis/restaurant.  The portions were huge; I took over half of mine home!  Food came out pretty quick too.  And I love free stuff, who doesn't?  With our purchase of our meals for their Anniversary special, we got a choice of Thai Iced Tea or Iced Coffee.  I asked our waitress, if the Thai Iced Coffee, tastes like Vietnamese Iced Coffee, with the condensed milk....she said, "I don't know."  Hmm, okay??  Despite that I decided to try it, I had nothing to lose anyway since it was free!  I watched as she poured the pitcher of coffee that was already out on the counter and grabbed the condensed milk out of the fridge and poured everything in a glass with ice.  It was alright...definitely not strong like Vietnamese coffee, which I liked, seemed a tad watery though.  

Service is alright.  Reminds me of a pho restaurant with condiments and some utensils at the side of the table.  But cheap food that isn't bad but that isn't the best that gets the job done!  As others have said, it's cash only at all locations.
author: Cat C.

description: I came here tonight so hungry and looking to seriously grub! Star #1 - they are opened 'til 10:30 pm. Star #2 the condiment caddy was full of awesome saucy treats to put on the appetizer. Star #3,4,5 RED CURRY and pad se lew!!! This place will hit the spot !!
author: J B.

description:
Years ago, I went to the King of Thai on Taraval and got something that turned me off to Thai food for a really long time. Today, I decided to give them a try since it's a different location hoping that would be better, and it was!

I got the sauteed eggplant and beef with bell peppers and tomatoes over rice. The rice wasn't very soft or fluffy.I felt like it could have used a little more water while cooking. The eggplant and beef tasted great with just the right amount of spice to it.

Boyfriend got yellow curry with beef. He claims to have loved it. I tried a couple bites, and it was pretty decent.

This place is cash only. The wait staff are okay. They were speaking what I am assuming was Thai a little too loud. They kept coming by to refill our waters to make sure everything was alright. Maybe next time I come here I'll try dessert and I can update this review.
author: M C.

description: I would say this place is definitely my least favorites of the King of Thai's mainly because the chicken from the yellow curry was a little dry and my papaya salad wasn't that great.
author: Lisa T.

description:
King of Thai on Sloat is cash only... who does that!?!?!?!  Haha I'm only joking.  I'm just really bad about carrying cash.  However I would like the option of at least paying by debit.

My favorite dish King of Thai serves is the Pad Ke Mao also known as Druken Noodles.  I like the spicy sweet flavor and the flat rice noodles.  It comes with string beans and your choice of meat.  I like beef because it soaks up the flavors of the spices better.  I have tried this dish at other Thai restaurants and they just don't match up to King of Thai's version!

If any one knows where I can get traditional Thai food, please message me!
author: Eleanor L.

description: I did not like the service here. I don't know if it was an off day but it took them 20 minutes to get out order after seating my friend & I! The staff did not glance our way at all. The food was rather bland. This will be a LAST RESORT option to fill my Thai craving from now on.
author: Tam T.

description:
I ordered number 41 with egg noddle....SOOOOO MUCH BETTER THAN THE KOT on Taraval...This had enough spice, lemon grass, noodles, and chicken...It wasn't bombarded with mushrooms like the one on Taraval and the chicken didn't have a rubbery texture....

I will go out of the way to come to this one than the Taraval location closer to me...better quality of food....I guess the Taraval one caters to High school kids who don't know any better.....
author: Brendan L.

description: This place is consistently solid with their variety of noodle soups and rice plates.  Try the beef noodle soup, roasted duck with a special Thai sauce over rice, eggplant, and woon sen pad thai.  The service is fast and good for large groups.  It's no wonder why local dragon boat teams eat here so often.  Best of all, the place is cheap.  With $6, you can feel warm and happy after a bowl or plate of noodles.
author: Jenny L.

description:
The food is good, but it's a bit too greasy sometimes.  They don't take credit card, so it's cash only.  Sigh.  And they have so many locations too!  I find the service at all of their locations to be horrible.  At least the food is cheap enough, and good enough to compensate for that loss.

I like their Pad seew lew and Roast duck fried rice, and sometimes I get the Satay chicken too.  Their noodle soups are good too.  

But you've been warned re greasiness and cash only policy.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I came here on a Sunday night, it wasn't too busy and we were seated immediately.  The waiters were friendly and quick.

I got the #15, the flat noodles with vegetables, egg, and chicken, it was good, not too sweet, just the right texture.  They also had an 80 cent thai iced tea deal so i had that too.

The price was good, only $7.25 for the noodles, and the portions were big, seems like they increased the size from the past.

Good experience, i will definitely come again.
author: Ben S.

description: We've been going to this near-home Thai restaurant and have enjoyed authentic Thai food and hospitable staff, including the manager/owner. The business changed management in February 2015. Last we went this week, the usual items we enjoyed weren't cooked the same or near before the change in ownership. The soup was tasteless like water with limited ingredients, the pad soo wen #16 didn't have the usual sweet soy sauce...more noodles than seafood; watery sauce. Higher price, low quality cooking, and defensive manager on our critique made us decide to not return. The only good thing is the place now accepts debit/credit cards.
author: L. M. L.

description:
Doesn't get much better at 2am.

This is one of my favorite places to eat after a night at the bars. They are open late so all the people wandering home from last call can get a bite. The food is good and plentiful. Its made quickly and eaten almost as fast. I can usually be found here, much to the chagrin of my diet and scale, once a week. 

The #30 Fried Chicken over Fried Rice (there's more to it than that) is my usual fare. I must have eaten this dozens of times, and every time it is as tasty as the first. 

Yes, They do take credit cards now. $10 min
author: Graham U.

description:
Place could be a bit cleaner and could use a freshening up, but $20 for two entrees and an appetizer can't be beat!  

CASH ONLY.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Just try the #15 and yelp me back.  You won't be disappointed.  

The service is quick and efficient.  Don't even bother with an appetizer, your main course will be ready in less than five minutes.  The food is cheap, the hours are convenient, the wait staff is courteous, there's a parking lot right in front.  The other locations are about the same (minus the parking lot).
author: Carol Y.

description:
We were looking for a quick place for Thai food for a quick bite yesterday and decided to come here. I like this location better than the one on taravel, because parking is easier, and its cleaner! Best of all, for the weekend (dine-in only) they give you a free Thai iced tea for every entree purchase. They also have weekday specials as well. 

We ordered a spicy beef dish with rice, pad see lew, and the tofu tod. The tofu tod is just slices of deep fried tofu with their peanut satay sauce. I love tofu, so I enjoyed this. The spicy beef with rice had a good flavor. I had ordered the chicken pad sew lew and was eating through it..when my bf asked me where the chicken was. Ha! I didn't even notice that there was not one single piece of chicken in the dish! I asked the waitress about it, she apologized and about 5-7 mins later she brought me a brand new one and apologized again. This time it had chicken and it was delicious!

Overall, its nothing fancy, just quick Thai food. I've had a noodle soup before and I didn't enjoy it much. Just stick to the basics and it should be fine.
author: Betty S.

description:
I do not know where to begin. My sister and I ordered take-out and was told a 15 minute wait. Went over to Lucky's nearby,  did some grocery shopping and sat and had my frozen yogurt at Nubi's only to return to King of Thai Noodle House with our order that wasn't ready yet. When we walked in, she said 5 more minutes. So we waited. 5 minutes were up, and all the servers began to avoid making eye contact with us. The place itself wasnt so busy, still with empty seating. 

At least another 20 minutes passed before we got our order, which were only 2 dishes. The server knew we were POed and smiled so graciously when giving us our order. As we were about to leave, she stopped us as though she was giving us another dish. Though, what she offered us were napkins. Seriously, lady? You think some napkins are going to make us happy about having to wait for almost an hour for our 2 dishes?!

When I dine in here, everything is fine. Service is okay, food is seasoned properly (+1 star). Got home to eat and the dishes were under salted. Was it because you were rushed? Because you were given nearly an hour. Waited almost an hour for unsalted thai food and 3 napkins, with no utensils. WOW THANKS.
author: Ada T.

description:
I found this place online, decided to try it out as we were going to visit the zoo. 
We were there way too early(right at opening) and the food was simply delish. 
Very clean and very good staff. Very polite and accomodating. I loved it.
author: Monica H.

description:
Of all the King of Thai restaurants, I love this one the best. I always order the #4 with flat rice noodles, mmm mmm good! The reason why this place is my favorite, well, I loves me the tendon, that's right, I said it. Apparently not for the faint hearted due to the texture as most of my friends have told me but hey, more for me, I'll go right ahead and dig yours out of your soup bowl. Mmmm, buttery soft and at this location, they pack it in your bowl like they took all of the animal's tendon and poured it in your soup. Like I said, not a favorite for most of whom I know. I do look for that one place that has the most and the best and this, my tendon loving friends, is the best. 
The service is always quick, I must say that this location has become quite popular because every time I stop by, it is usually full on any given Sunday. I crave this soup, I am that person who takes up all the pickled chilies and place it in my soup, they do not skimp on the other items either such as the beef brisket, noodles, and morning glory/greens. Wash it down with a Thai iced tea and you got one happy me. 
The only thing is that they take cash only.
author: Natasha C.
Joel B.

description:
Are all the King of Thai restaurants owned by the same person?!? I sure hoped so, but this place doesn't do any justice to the other King of Thai's I've had.

I don't think I like this one very much, although the pad thai is okay, the other stuff could be better. Last time I had the Fried Chicken over Fried Rice and that was okay even though the chicken was a bit dry. Although my sister's Pad See Ew needed either some more sauce or some more flavor, I'm not sure what was worse. 

I'll go here if it's the last King of Thai place in SF.

happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description: I'm always up for some Thai food! It was my first time coming in here and since first impressions always count, I thought their customer service was excellent! The waitress greeted me right away and she was quick in taking my order as soon as I was done figuring out what I wanted. The portions were reasonable and the prices are not bad! However, the downside of this place is that they only take cash. There is a Wells Fargo bank that's located in the same shopping center if you need it. All in all, if you're in the area and lookin' for some good Thai food for lunch, this is a great place!
author: Medelyn S.

description:
We've been eating here for several years and have mostly had positive experiences. Frequently we come in with large groups of about 20 and are always accommodated. Sometimes the bill gets dicey, but we usually figure it out. This place is cheap, fast and annoyingly CASH only. 

We came in this past week with an out of town guest and were served by a surly, impatient waitress. A far cry from what we've experienced in the past. Yes, there was some confusion with what we were ordering and when we asked her to come back, she delivered major attitude. Fine. We just wanted to eat and be on our merry way. 

Like usual, our dishes came out with in 5 minutes (amazing!) My Phad Thai tasted like fish. Something I've never encountered. I took maybe 5 bites trying to figure out what the deal was. I didn't figure it out but couldn't eat any more. 

The next morning, all 3 of us were sick with the same problem. Seriously upset stomachs. This hasn't happened to us before, so I'll assume it was a fluke. Maybe something that the 3 of us ate before we got to this restaruant, but we couldn't figure out what that would have been. I'll probably go to our other favorite Thai restaurant from now on.
author: Heidi S.

description:
This place is awful and I'm surprised I haven't gotten food poisoning.

Usually I'd get takeout so I'd walk  up to the unfriendly girl at the register say "pad thai with prawns" she'd give me a blank stare, if that, and tell me the total.

Then they'd slowly make my food while I look at the low 90s health inspection report card. Low 90s is only OK when you have 5 APs and you just need an A- to keep that 4.63 semester GPA.

Oh, and they nickel and dime you for everything. 
~"A few more peanuts" = "Extra charge." 
~"Can I get a little peanut sauce" = "Extra charge"
If I asked for my money back I wonder what they'd say...

Only eat here if you're really, really tired of everything else at Lakeshore (and Stonestown)
author: Elena C.

description:
I've tried their: pad thai, duck noodle soup, red pumpkin curry, mango w/ sticky rice, and another flat noodle dish that I can't remember very well other than it was on the salty side. I've also had their thai milk tea here which was pretty good but a little too sweet. Mango w/ sticky rice is bomb as always but unfortunately they tend to run out late at night.

The best experience I've had here so far is with their pad thai. The duck in their noodle soup is really fatty and the other noodle dishes that I've had here over the 5 or 6 times I've come have been either salty or kinda bland.

Overall... it's okay. The boyfriend loves the curry here so we keep coming back. It's also right down the street from where we live so it's worth coming back.

I would've given it 3.5 stars, but I guess i'd say just flat 3 for being cash only on top of everything.
author: Melody S.

description: Pad kee mao and the gang dang curry was delicious. Thai ice tea was like any other thai ice tea you would get anywhere.  Quick friendly services, clean, and easy parking. B/B+
author: Eric Y.

description:
King of Thai Noodle House really perplexes me.  Why on earth would anybody go through the effort of starting up a restaurant in San Francisco - one of the most competitive restaurant markets in the country - hire staff that can perfectly execute a meal, and spend the money on the freshest ingredients available, only to churn out dishes that are about as bland and boring as a cream of Saltine cracker soup?  Maybe, as some reviewers suggest, this restaurant has consistency issues, and I just happened to catch it in one of its bland moments.  Or maybe its neighborhood clientele are such wussies that even a drop of fish sauce in their food would cause their heads to explode.  Either way, taking classic Thai cuisine and sucking most of the flavor out of it is a food crime, right up there with the use of soy filler in the Great American Hamburger.

Take, for example, the Poh Piar Tod (deep fried vegetarian egg rolls) that I ordered there recently, which were fried to perfection.  Their rice wrapper skins were paper thin, light as a feather, and crunchy - far better than I've seen in many more upscale restaurants.  Inside each roll was a mix of finely and exquisitely chopped bean thread noodles, slivered carrots, cabbage bits, and taro root slices (the menu said 'black mushroom,' but they must have run out of black mushrooms that day).  As perfectly prepared as these rolls were, however, they were dominated by too many starches and nearly tasteless.  They did come with a sticky, red dipping sauce whose hot, sweet flavor overwhelmed what little flavor there was in the rolls.  It was a bit like eating pretzel sticks dipped in the liquid remains of a melted cinnamon lollipop.

The Pad Woon Sen, which I ordered as the main course, suffered from a similar lack of anything my taste buds could recognize as flavor. I could not detect the flavor of any garlic, chopped scallions, soy sauce, fish sauce, or oyster flavor sauce - some or all of which are typically used to add flavor to this dish, as bean thread noodles are otherwise virtually tasteless.  Despite creating a dish that had all the flavor of the stuffing in your favorite seat cushion, the chef still took the time and effort to execute it well - the bean thread noodles were neither overly dry nor wet and mushy,  the chicken and scrambled egg in the dish were cooked through properly, and carrots, celery, and other vegetables in the dish were cut into incredibly delicate slivers.  Expending so much effort on food this boring is like serving the most expensive Rothchild's red that you can find in paper Dixie cups - it seems like such a waste!

I didn't have any issues here with the service, and the minimalist ambience here was OK for the type of restaurant that this is.  My issues with this restaurant come down solely to the food that they serve.  Some folks like their food bland and boring like this, and I am more than happy to give up my spot at the King of Thai Nood;e House's table for them.  For me, I give King of Thai Noodle House a rating of 2/5 stars.
author: Arnel G.

description:
I first went here when I lived at SF state. I thought it was delicious Thai food. After moving away from state, and trying other Thai restaurants, I still think its great. I went to a place closer to me that had better reviews and ordered the same dish I always get at King of Thai, the Pra Ram. At the fancier, better reviewed place, the Pra Ram was not good. After eating there I was craving the Pra Ram from King of Thai. Their food is tasty and the portions are large.
Yes it sucks that they don't accept credit cards, but I am willing to go to the ATM for them. 
I've been to the Clement location too, but this one is much better. Overall, I won't doubt that you can get better Thai food somewhere else, but for now I love this place and their Pra Ram.
author: Sarah M.

description: I like King of Thai, it's one of those places where I already know what I want and I know what I will be getting. Very uniform, the dishes are exactly the same from one king of thai to the next. Great place for a quick lunch or late night meal. Food comes out in like 5 mins after you order it (which makes me wonder sometimes....) Service is never awesome but also never horrible.
author: Jenn T.

description:
If you love fried rice, this is the place to go. I can't think of a place that does it better.

Prices are super reasonable, food is cooked fast. Just remember to bring cash, because that's all they accept!
author: Paul M.

description:
King of Thai is a decent place.  It seems as though ordering to go will give you the higher probability of getting more food.  Now this doesn't mean you WILL get more food.  Just a higher chance of it happening.

I ordered the Pad See Ew and Pad Thai to go.  They had a lot of the Pad See ew, but the Pad Thai box was  significantly less full.  Seemed as though half of what was there was bean sprouts as well.  The Pad See Ew was okay. My only complaint is that the beef was very chewy/hard.  It might be that Thai people like to have their beef cooked this way, because I don't think I've ever had Beef Pad See Ew where it wasn't

I also ordered Thai Iced Tea.  While it was delicious, they really filled the cup with ice (but what store doesnt?)  

Service is fine here, except while I was waiting to pick up my food, the cashier waited for a lady to order her food to go instead of serving me while she looked at the menu.  

Other than that, it's a fine place to go for Thai
author: Andrew T.

description: Not bad... But not great either. It a poor copy of the real deal on clement st. The only thing this place really has going for it is easy parking. It will do if you want something quick and easy, if you really want some good noodles go fight for parking on clement street and get the real deal at the original king of Thai noodle.
author: Paul H.

description:
Like others have mention, if you live in SF you know King of Thai Noodle House. They are everywhere and opened late for all you late night eaters.  As i recall my first time dinning at the this chain of thai food was on a weekend trip visiting downtown Sf 4 years ago on powel. 

This place particular is small but never too busy. People usually order togo and pick it up. We always get seated and the service is beyond good. Their fast and attentive on refilling your drinks. 
I think right now their having a special on FREE thai tea for their anniversary.

I love this place because its cheap and fast and of course yummy. Not as authentic but they offer a variety of all different sorts of thai food. My boyfriends thai and he says this place is decent to being close to authentic thai food.

Must order items are:
-Duck fried rice (4.5 stars)
-Seafood salad (5)
-pad see ew beef (4.5)

Order them and trust me you won't be disappointed!
author: Jacinta D.

description:
We have been going here for the past like 2 years almost twice a week. Today we went in and one of us had a Quiznos meal. note: Only one of us had a quiznos bag and the other 3 were going to eat in.The girl came up to us and pointed at the sign on the door that says "no outside food allowed." We think this is a new policy and said "oh come on you know we are faithful customers" 
"sorry" she said "it's the restaurant policy"
We thought to ourselves, "you just lost really valuable customers" the way the economy is doing, we don't think restaurants should be so picky. They already have a cash only policy. Let's see what "policy" they come up with next.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description: this one is probably the worse king of thai i have been to. i had pad see ew, and the veggies were no longer  a bright green but now a dull and dingy green with a very bitter taste to it. And thats not the first time, i e been idsappointed with this location. their vegetables in other noodle dishes don't seem to be fresh yet they dont seem to care. the service is always fast, but u tend to get ignored even if u try to get the check from them. thai ice tea is probably the best part about this KOT, you really can't mess that up!
author: Stella J.

description: good solid pad thai and crab fried rice.  service was good, water was always filled.  both dishes lacking a little punch, not sure what's missing but needed a little bit more flavor.
author: Will I A m.

description:
Disappointing. As. Hell.

The entire time I was on the treadmill at the gym, all I could think about was indulging in a plate of Pad See Ew from King of Thai. I had it all planned out: I was going to swing by Taraval on my way home, pick up a #15 Pad See Ew, steal some peppers from the hidden stash under the cart, and go home to a nice toasty meal. Buttt, I decided since I had videos to return at Blockbuster, I'd kill 2 birds with one stone and head to the King of Thai on Sloat instead. Big mistake.

I waited an eternity for my order and when it finally got to our table, it was cold as ice. I stirred it around my plate hoping that maybe the noodles underneath were still warm and saucy... but no. Just a plate of cold ass noodles on a cold ass night. Yuck.

I asked the waitress if she wouldn't mind taking it back because it was way too cold to the *touch* to enjoy. She gladly took it back, and my faith was briefly restored. That is, until I saw her open up the microwave and nuke my noodles for a good 2 minutes :(  They came out as expected: burning hot in some places, freezing cold in others. The sauce was even more evaporated and I sat there poking at the heap of noodles in front of me wishing I had just made the extra effort to go to Taraval. I'm still regretting that decision *sigh*

Ps. To the couple who's table was right next to ours and had steaming, fresh, saucy looking food: Damn you both.
author: La De Da C.

description:
Rating. -10

They DEMANDED a tip for a party of four and decided that they could automatically charge us 15% because they felt our tip was not good enough for them.

Then, they decided that it was ok to tell me that I should have enough money  to tip them better if I could afford to eat out, and that they would refuse service next time we came in.  (there is no next time)

I didn't know that it was ok demand a tip from a paying customer, and talk s**t to them during work hours.
author: Max T.

description: I love King of Thai, but I refuse to go to this location ever again.  Why?  Food poisoning is NOT THE BUSINESS.  Especially not right before flying out in the early morning the next day.  I didn't even eat seafood!  I ordered my "go-to" dish of pad kee mao with chicken and it must have been the chicken or something that was undercooked or old. The sauce and noodles' texture wasn't quite right either. Should have known then and stopped eating, but well, never coming here again!
author: Dee H.

description:
$18.20.

Twenty dollar bill, one dime, ten pennies.

Waitress: "We don't take pennies."

Twenty dollar bill, two dimes.

Tip: One dollar, ten pennies.

Waitress: "Take back your pennies; we don't need them."


You. Have. Got. To. Be. Kidding. Me. You don't take pennies?! You're going to refuse my money?? And then you have the nerve to tell me that you don't need my pennies when I'm TIPPING you?! Are you seriously telling me that you don't need my money!? Then WHY am I even paying you. Why. Really, why. Your food is not even worth it.
author: Christine L.

description:
On yelp it displays this place opening at 10:30am.

Ok,so I call about 10:15am and try to order for a quick pick up and the person (woman) answered and responded by saying
this:

Woman: We are not open yet.

(note- I thought I could perhaps call and put in my order a few minutes before opening and then pick it up after 10:30am)

Me: Oh,ok but I have a question..
Woman:...click
Me: What the....
Me:Did she just...

I call back a little after 10:30am and the same thing happened and she repeated they were not open.

Strange,yet odd.

It was kind of weird and I am not going to let this experience stop me from exploring more Thai restaurants.
author: Dani D.

description: I love dis place! far superior to a regular noodle house there open late to. Bring cash though
author: Andrew S.

description:
Props to this location for:

*Being so close to where I go to school.

But boo because they close early (before midnight).

[Look up KoT Taraval Review for my fav dishes]
author: Christine C.

description:
If you live in SF, you probably know that there are quite a few of these places all over.  The menu's the same but the food slightly differs at each one....mostly because of the chef I suppose.  This one's the one I goto the most often.  It's in a lil mall with crappy parking.  Spots are tight and people in general can't drive.  

So all of the King of Thai places are fast and the food in general is pretty good.  I've had some bad things but I'd probably say 85% of the time, the food is good.  My favorite dish is the duck over yao choy with rice.  I've tried about half the menu and this is now my staple unless I actually have a craving for something else.  

I was there yesterday for lunch after dragon boat practice and my team and another team pretty much filled up the whole restaurant.  It was probably a total of about 36 people.  The food came out really quick considering we all arrived at about the same time though they did have problems getting all the food out at once.  I sat at a table of 8 and it probably took about 10 min to get the first and last dish to the table.
author: Eddie L.

description:
The King of Thai Restaurants seem to be located all over the City these days. I tend to usually have a great lunch or dinner at one of their locations. However, I was not too thrilled about their location on Sloat near Albertson's (now Lucky's). They seem to rush you in everything they do ---- from ordering, to cooking the food, to getting you the bill and rushing you out of there. I don't know why b/c when we dined there, there was only four other people in the restaurant. I was pretty disappointed with my order, which was the Fried chicken pieces over fried rice. The chicken was overly oily and greasy and the rice was OLD! It was hard and hard to eat. I could have returned it and complained but I'm not that type of person. I basically lost my appetite and paid the bill. I'm sure they wanted me out of there anyways. 

One star for the location and one star for their Thai iced tea. I'll try another location --- hopefully I'll have better service and a better experience there.
author: La C.

description:
It was a weird that there seemed to be a waitress for every table in this little place. They must be employing every cousin (that is female and under 17) that they have.
 
They have an *80 rating from the inspector. Well, there is always room for improvement right?

We ordered food to go and it was ready in under 15 minutes. Things were looking up!
My food was good and it was the perfect amount of spicy.

Reasonably good food, average price, good parking, fast service.
author: Melissa B.

description:
There's something to be said about quick and dirty. It's American.

Well, okay this place ain't American but it's darn tooting close.

It's a real sit down meal, you can't say it's not. It's clean, you got a waitress and there's an appetizer menu.

But there's always parking, the prices are cheap and the food comes briskly.

The food isn't bad, it isn't expensive and it's convenient. Why not King of Thai?
author: Joe Z.

description:
Service was bad.

I came here to eat with my girlfriend and little sister. No one greeted us. It wasn't busy at all. It was just one guy and one lady working there. We sat ourselves down and I even had to grab the menu for ourselves. Maybe I was being impatient but since it wasn't busy at all, I don't see any reason for them not to at LEAST greet us. 

As we looked at the menu, the lady waiter came and I ordered Tom Yum G soup or something like that. I assumed there was noodles in it but I suppose I assumed wrong. More on this later. I said 3 orders. + 3 Thai Ice Teas.

3 Thai Ice Teas came promptly served by the lady.

5 minutes later. 1 soup came to our table. Ok, I realized there was some confusion. But since it was a big bowl of soup, I figure we could split it anyway. I looked and realized I made the wrong assumption that there were noodles in this soup. You know. Kinda like Pho. 

So I asked the GUY waiter whether it came with noodles or not. He said No but he could offer a bowl of noodles, and what kind of noodles would I like. Well I said "Thin rice noodles" Either he didnt hear me or thin rice noodles was not an option. He asked me again in a CONDESCENDING tone "What kind of noodles" Well WTF!!! I just told him. And I do not like people who talk in condescending tones. I asked "Ok... what kind of noodles do you have" He blurted a list of noodles and I just chose vermicelli cuz that was the last one I heard. 

He brought the vermicelli over and we ate our meal.

Halfway through the meal. The GUY waiter asked the adjacent table (seated by two 30-40 yr olds) if everything was okay. Then he turned, glanced sideways at our table, without a word, and walked back to the counter. I don't know if it was cuz we looked like a bunch of young kids that just came from the street. I dislike that kind of treatment.

I don't know if I will ever come here again.
author: David N.

description:
i love the this King of Thai more than other others in the city.  The place is small and the parking is tough when it's busy, which is practically every day, but i'm willing to wait to get my fix of prad ga prow (minced chicken or pork, sauteed with hot peppers) or pad thai.  

In the restaurant, there are maybe less than 8 tables to sit at, so it's no wonder you'll see people coming in and out, picking up their take-out orders.
author: Ray R.

description:
Eh, this King of Thai should be renamed King of Runs as I have suffered one too many loose stool moments after dining at this location.  Good thing I live close by because the bathroom is a huge ick factor. 

The Taraval outpost of this joint is so much better.  Just drive 5 minutes more and your stomach (and toilet) will thank you.
author: Courtney B.

description: The best curry I ever ate! Strongly recommend!
author: ANASTASIA K.

description:
For my first visit at King of Thai Noodle House, food was delicious, tasty, and abundant. It doesn't hurt that prices were moderately affordable. We ordered #17 pad kee mao with beef, #31 kao pad gai tod, and Thai ice tea, and was served in under 3 minutes.

The pad kee mao had just the right amount of heat in spiciness and wasn't excessively greasy. I surmise that grease from the ground beef provided enough oil to cook the flat rice noodles. There was TLC in the food preparation: they made the noodles and Chinese green beans manageable to eat by cutting them nice and short.

I enjoyed pad kee mao more than the kao pad gai tod. The fried batter didn't stick to the chicken and was neither crispy, salty nor flavorful, but I guess the accompanying sweet and sour sauce is supposed to help. I just wish they gave more of the sauce. The chicken breast itself was a bit bland; however, there was enough meat to be satisfied. I was disappointed with the small size and quantity of scrambled eggs in the fried rice--it's barely noticeable.  And they could have added more onions and tomatoes instead of treating them like garnish. But I liked the spices in Thai fried rice contrasted to the Chinese soy-sauce based counterpart.

The Thai ice tea was great, though they filled half the cup with ice, and wasn't overly sweet. The tea could be a little stronger. The milk used  in ice tea reminded me of the taste of Vitasoy soy milk.

One regret I have is not trying their $18 dine-in special, which includes an appetizer, rice plate and noodle plate. So I could've stretched the dollar and taste more Thai cuisine.
author: Cliff W.

description:
Thank you KOT for reminding me why I don't order food from here. The pad thai was bland and dry and their cashew chicken was gummy and overcooked! I've been to every KOT in SF and they are NOT all the same!

Honestly, how can you f#ck up pad thai? Isn't that every thai restaurant's  standard dish? It sucks when you order two dishes and you end up raiding your fridge to eat leftovers instead.
author: Ezduzit S.

description:
hmm...what is difference between this king of thai and other locations? 

clean and closes early compare to 2am.

every KOT i visit, i always order the same thing. 

#30 please. 

thank you. :)
author: Carol Y.

description: Come here just for the pad see ew! They give a plentiful amount, fresh and hot! The chicken, pork, and beef all go well with it, having the perfect amount of taste. I also get the Thai Iced tea which is 100% authentic and sweet. Writing this review is making me salivate. Food comes SUPAFAST! Whenever I come there's always the same nice smiley waitress. Love this place.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I cannot recommend King of Thai Noodle House on Sloat Blvd.

I ate at this restaurant several times, returning becuase I enjoyed the food, the service is good, and the prices are reasonable.  However my most recent visit was my last.

The reason I will no longer go there is that on my last visit I made the mistake of using the rest room.  While waiting for the rest room to be avaialable, I stood in the hallway adjacent to the door to the kitchen.  

What I saw while standing there appalled me.  The place is *absolutely filthy* almost beyond belief for an establishment that prepares & serves food.  The floor is filthy ... I mean black with dirt.  The walls are dirty.  Even places the staff would touch with their hands (like the light switch & wall plate) were super filthy.  Looking around, I found myself wondering how many years it had been since they did any cleaning there ... if ever.

Unfortunately, seeing that filth has spoiled my appetite for King of Thai Noodle House.  I gave it a 2 star rating, since the other attributes were quite good... though the filth factor tempted me to rate it at 1 instead...
author: Bill H.

description:
(This review is for the King of Thai Noodle House at 184 O'Farrell Street)
 
If time is more important than taste for choosing a lunch spot, then you will love this place for lunch and the food is decent.   Watching the waitresses run around the restaurant was like watching a 3D version of the T.V. Show "The Jetsons" but instead of malfunctioning robots, the friendly waitresses served our food in 5 minutes and refilled my water 3 times.
author: Josh K.

description:
Love the sliced duck noodle soup. i always have a craving for that once in a while... its sooo goodddd.... especially in cold weather.

I have only tried this other dish with thick noodles in gravy, it was pretty good but they gave me a LOT of veges, even more than noodle! i was surprised how i actually finished the entire dish!

Many locations in SF, service isn't anything special.
author: Erica L.

description:
not the best king of Thai out of all the one's they have in San Francisco but still love it! This is the closest one to my house and especially love them because it's right next to work, can it get any better?

I loved how they remembered what I order, #15 Pay See Lew w/ ground beef and even gave me a free thai iced tea! Thanks to the crew.

btw, what happened to the guy w/ the small pony tail? HE DISAPPEARED! he was real chill though, cool guy. 

the place is not too big, not the cleanest either thats why for the negative star but i still love the food and their service is good, just a little slower when it gets busy at night and on the weekends. 

new fav: #21 w/ ground beef!
author: Kenny L.

description:
I really should go take a pregnancy test.  

I have been craving Thai for weeks.  Its odd, I generally don't eat Thai food.  Its not that I have anything against curry, or noodles, or other forms of Asian deliciousness--its just generally its not something that is brought to my attention.  I digress.

Ahem.  

*Regroup*

Scott and I both got the curry.  Its your standard, subpar, no frills location (c'mon, its right be an albertsons for god's sake) but when you are craving spices from the far east and you haven't worked for three months, you'll settle for the poor ambiance/service.  As far as the food goes, four stars.  Maybe its a little biased, but it really hit the spot.  I kept eating even when I was uncomfortably full, and practically had to be rolled out of the establishment.

I'll probably be back for lunch sometime soon.  I can kill two birds with one stone: eat at KOT and stop by Albertsons for that pregnancy test.

I ooze of class.
author: Erika W.

description: This place is on my all-time favorite's list for sure!  All the dishes are great, near the Zoo too, I want to drive there from San Ramon right now!  Nothing like this place out here!
author: Kevin J.

description: I really want to love this place since its nearby but every time I eat here everything seems bland like no flavor at all. I gave it a lot of chances but its still the same! I love their service since they're fast and i can just call for to go orders and pick it up after 15 minutes and its ready. So I really only go here to fix my thai food cravings since its closer.
author: Nikka L.

description:
pretty decent quick fix of thai food...i like the staff there unless there's a bias towards me because i happen to work right next door.  the owners are super friendly and very helpful.  i just find them all, including the servers, to be really nice people.  i've never had any problems with the food.  everything i've ordered was cooked quickly and as good as it can get from this fast thai food chain restaurant.  i normally order the eggplant or panang curry or the fried chicken with fried rice...i love all of them.  i've had better....but hey, there's nothing like walking next door and having your food ready in 5 minutes.  

khan toke is so much better but there is never a wait to get a table here.  oh.  and compared to the other king of thai noddle house's, parking is great and plentiful.  woo woo.
author: Jen W.

description:
Good (not great) Thai Noodles.  I've eaten here several times, and never been severely disappointed, but then again never been wowed.  King's is solid, never really bad, and often crowded.  It's open late also - 1 am, and I like that.

But imho there are other slightly more tasty & fresh Thai restaurants in the immediate area (see my other reviews of Thai restaurants for that).
author: Jack H.

description:
Fast, inexpensive Thai food. 

Cash only. 

Pre-made mixed tea for their "thai-iced tea". 

Don't expect much and you will be delighted eating here.
author: Kimiko Q.

description: I used to go to this location all the time for lunch on Saturdays.  This time, my bf and I went for dinner.  They had dimmer lighting than what I was used to...but that's probably since it was for dinner.  Dinner took a bit longer than normal...but dishes were still good.
author: B C.

description: The first time me and my boyfriend came here, we weren't able to go because it was cash only. So yesterday, me and my boyfriend went cause i've been wanting to take him here since i've been to the one downtown with some friends back in 2008. I got the kao pad? which had meat, fried rice w/eggs, tomatoes, and a side of cucumber. My boyfriend got the pad thai cause on Wednesdays it is $1 off. They have other specials too like Fri-Sun you get a free iced thai tea or a thai coffee. I forgot to tell the lady to not put eggs on my dish because i'm allergic to it. Me and my boyfriend ended up switching plates. Either way, both dishes were really good.
author: Janice V.

description: Currently my favorite location of the King of Thai many restaurants in SF. Mainly it's due to the convenient location at Lakeshore Plaza just around by Lucky's and Blockbusters when I do my visits there. This location does not open late night though, probably for the neighbrhood it's in.
author: H K.

description:
Came here with 2 friends tonight, and it was the first time eating here. Usually we go to the other Taraval branch, but decided that we would try this place out. Consequently my friends got pineapple fried rice, roast duck stir fried rice, and I got Pad Kee Mao with beef. We awaited our order which didn't take too long.

I will say this. I'm usually very biased against local favorites. I really really like the taraval branch, not so much for their service, but the food tastes spicier, and usually the food is tasty. This branch seemed to cater to a crowd that perhaps has less of a stomach for a constant burning tongue, but overall it was good. The service people were attentive, and although a bit smaller than the Taraval branch, there wasn't as big of a crowd, and the decor in my opinon was nicer. It's also a tad cleaner, but that could due to the fact that the place doesn't get too many customers during the early evening. 

The Pad Kee Mao dish had more noodles and less chilis. Usually that's a bad thing, but the Taraval branch seems to put on the hot and turn the knob to 11. It's not a bad thing, but sometimes the thai iced tea isn't enough to quiet the flaming burn. Also, there apparently was less grease used to cook the food. If you ever get this same dish from the Taraval branch, after finishing your dish, there's a lot of brown grease at the bottom of your plate. That can't be too healthy for you. This place was significantly less heavy on the grease, and the remaining oil on my plate was clear, so that's gotta be healthier.

The pineapple fried rice had less rice, but more stuff... aka chicken, pineapple, etc. The roast duck stir fry rice was apparently well appreciated by my friend as well.

Overall not bad, and since my friend recently moved closer to this location, we'll probably frequent this place more. Slightly healthier options, and the waiters/waitresses are more friendly, and don't serve with an cold attitude. The decor is nicer, and cleaner, and the patrons aren't overflowing the tables. Nice experience, would definitely recommend this place. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Clinton L.

description: Love this place they give u big portions and the food comes out super fast and it's delicious I always get the pad see ew! And the som tum it's really good I love it when I feel like getting good Thai food this is where I go plus it's not too expensive it's definetly worth the 7 dollar plate
author: Alvin B.

description: I used to love this place.  One of my faves was beef and eggplant over rice.  Last time I was there, that was off the menu but you could get beef and eggplant over noodles.  I got a mouthful of spice in one bite - obviously not mixed very well - which ruined whole lunch for me.  I have not been back.  I think they changed cooks.
author: Erika L.

description: This King of Thai Noodle is a pathetic example of a Thai restaurant!  The people are not friendly, the aren't very good cooks making your food, and the prices of their items are what you would pay in a higher scale Thai restaurant such as Marnee Thai.  I went there because I remember going to the one over on Clement Street and it was pretty decent.  For the convenience and hurry, I paid the price with having mediocre Thai food.  The Gai Ga Praw (ground chicken stir fried with basil & chili) was unpalatable even when I was already starving.   That tells you how bad it must have been!  The rice was mushy and the chicken dish, which should be packed with flavors of spicy, sweet, salty, herby, fragrant was absent of flavor and weren't cooked long enough to release these ingredient.  Needless to say, I'm deeply disappointed with this joint and I will never, ever, patronize them again!  I'll drive a little further over to Taraval location or to Marnee Thai instead so that my reward is well cooked food!  Damn you, KTN on Sloat, for ruining my Sunday treat!!!  One star for you!  I'll give you zero but that's not an option!

I love King of Thai, and the one by Union Square got 5 stars.  This one, not as good.  The food is not as high-quality, and it never seems to be as busy as the other branches I've been too.  That could possibly be because it's way out in the lower Sunset, but still.  Sometimes the food is good like at the other King of Thais, but it's really hit-or-miss here.  The waitresses (depending on the time you go//who's working) can be really rude.  I don't really care if the wait staff isn't really friendly or whatever, but I appreciate when they do their jobs.  Things like refilling water, remembering your order, not standing behind the counter with their jackets and purses, glaring at us, waiting for us to leave.  It was more than half an hour before they closed when we left!  Kind of what the hell.
If you just want cheap food and you're in the neighborhood, it's fine, but if you have the means to go to one of the other restaurants they have in the city, then maybe skip this location.
author: Allison B.

description: Cheap, fast and quick. Not the best Thai food in the city but not the worst either. As another reviewer put it: it's Thai fast food.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Thai restaurants can be broken down into two categories: noodle shops and everything else.  This is a noodle shop.  Their specialty is going to be the Thai noodle soup, and perhaps some of the noodle plates, but really it's the Thai noodle soup called 'Kiaw Diew.'  

I'll walk you through how to order the noodles.  When ordering noodles you get two options: noodles and meat.  They have 3 types: Thin rice noodle, egg noodle, and thick rice noodle (sometimes called boat noodles.  I chose thin rice noodle (my favorite.) You get to pick what kind of meat you want: stewed beef (from the broth), meatballs, or sliced beef.  I chose the combination.  The combination also had some beef linings in it too in case you don't like that.  I'm not a huge fan, but I'll put up with it.

Once you get your bowl of noodles (about 5 minutes later) then comes the fun part.  You get to modify it to your tastes with the dry red pepper and the 'nam som' or pickled pepper (this is the sliced green peppers in the clear liquid.)  First I test the broth to see how it is "raw." After that I add lots of red pepper.   Then add the pickled pepper to even out the flavor so that it's not too sweet.  

That being said this was a huge bowl of noodles and it was excellent.  I have to give them 4 stars out of 5 because they didn't have any beer. Singha beer goes hand in hand with this meal.
author: Chris C.

description:
