This is the yummy stuff right here. Used to come here all the time when I lived in the neighborhood. Food, fobs, and fresh Thai tea. Good eatins.

On the nights I wanted to take a break from all the craziness, I'd eat here, rent a movie next door, then go home and chill. Or just on rainy/foggy day, which there are many in this area, have some hot food and watch the crazy asian shows they play on the TV.

Khawp khun khrap
author: Sol V.

description: im sorry for putting it this way but it taste like shit.
author: Linda A.

description:
Ok so after school today , a bunch of friends and i wanted to get something to eat. Before i came to this restaurant, i didn't really like the sound of it.. but it was a majority rule thing. Ok so we went there, it was kinda dark inside.. i hate eating in a dark area. 

Ok on to the food. I ordered the chicken noodle.. i forgot what it was called. But i have to say. the Noodles were pretty darn good. The food was pretty decent.

Now why i gave it a 3.. well .. it was too dark for me sorry thats just me. and the service wasn't that great. Looked at us like we weren't going to pay or something. and the place wasn't really clean. but ya thats pretty much it. Overall it was okay
author: Andrew H.

description:
I don't know what happened! 

I had fond, if not stellar, memories of pigging out on pad thai here during my senior year at the nearby high school. But when I went today with the mother and sister, everything was salty salty salty! 

I got the "Chef Recommended" #48 (or maybe it was #58?) sauteed eggplant in some soy/Thai chili sauce with veggies&tofu and rice. Normally you can't mess up sauteed eggplant with me, but this was below my expectations. Even Panda Express has better eggplant than this. I turned to the tofu for solace, but it had soaked up all the sauce, revealing itself to be cubes of salt in disguise.

Now I realize this is King of Thai NOODLE House, but even the pad thai (that the mom and sis shared) was subpar. It too had OD'd on sodium chloride and was not lookin too happy or fresh. Even the peanuts, apparently confuzzled by the fact that they missed the salt party, were in a sad pile to the side rather than sprinkled on top.

2.5 for the sweet Thai iced tea, quick service (for a 1:40pm lunch), and the vast selection of spicy condiments at the table that oh-so-delighted my mother. Here's hoping they have a future ration on salt so I can bump it up to a 3!
author: Leah C.

description: Went there in the evening. It's close to SFSU, which is nice. Had chicken sauté, spring rolls, and pad thai. I thought it was pretty good.
author: Patrick M.

description: DON'T COME HERE. If you do, you'll be sorry. Compared to the other King of Thai's, this comes no where close in terms of taste or service. Small portions, less than stellar service, and usually order a friend's favorite spicy chicken rice something or rather (can't remember the name) and the chicken was so tough, couldn't eat it, wrapped in foil, like it was leftovers. Usually never wrapped when ordered at other King of Thai. The service could use some help. Kids running the place think they're the shit, oh yes I stand in awe of someone who works at a King of thai restaurant on Sloat. Give me a break. Shoulda went to Osha, damn't! If I could give minus stars I would. If you've learned anything from this post, it's to not come here.
author: Linda H.

description: I vote for the vegetarian hot and sour soup, lemongrass and galanga are involved, and it's #40something on the menu. I know this is the most resourceful review you've read.
author: Em L.

description:
It's exactly an "a-ok" place, with "a-ok" prices and "a-ok" food. I wouldn't take a date here! My biggest gripe is that they don't take cards, and the nearest ATM is inside the Lucky's. 

I am never particularly disappointed by my orders, but there is definitely room for improvement. Their duck fried rice... lacking quite a bit of duck.

If you're looking to get full on a cheap dime, go into Albertson's and buy yourself some groceries. However, I am relatively satisfied with the attentive wait staff even when they are busy.
author: Michael C.

description:
"CASH ONLY!  CASH ONLY!"  That's all I hear from them!  Aye yaaaa!  It's like, damn, stop trying to avoid taxes, but then again, I give them props for "stickin' it to the MAN!"

The food is good and their Thai iced tea is never watered down.  The service stinks as I asked for water 4 times until I had to go up to the counter and demand for it.  But hey, what do you expect from an Asian restaurant?  That's how we roll!  

Decent food for a decent price with delicious thai iced tea.  Oh yes, parking is easy to find at the Sloat location but somewhat difficult at the Taraval.  My recommendations?  Pineapple fried rice, green curry with chicken, thai iced tea and pad thai.
author: Manton R.

description: The staff is friendly, and the food is great. Pad Thai is always a safe food decision. I love it how there is a variety of foods to choose from. I have been to the King of Thai Noodle House in Downtown, and I must admit that I like this restaurant more. This restaurant is less fast-paced and way less noisy. The art along the walls create a nice ambiance to the room. If you're looking for Thai food, this is the place to go!
author: Dana S.

description: I use to go to this place during my breaks in high school, but nowadays I haven't been going here that much. This place is pretty good but I find it inconsistent sometimes. On a good day, the curry can be great with the right texture, but a couple of times I went there it was too thick... But I'll still come here whenever I want some quick thai food. Another thing that sucks is that they only accept cash.
author: Nick L.

description:
The Pad Prik Khing is great. And the Pad See Yew is also good with noodles that are flavorful rather than the clumped together dull stuff you tend to get at cheap Thai shops. I was really amazed at the quality of the food for such a little chain thai place. 

Sadly, their curries are bland, so if you're in the mood for curry go elsewhere. 

- Prices are cheap
- Service is good and quick
- Atmosphere is expectingly blah with the typical Thai pop music videos playing overhead.
author: Colin F.

description:
So cheap, so good. Great for an individual, great for a group, great for families. Soup, Satay, Rice dishes, Curry, Stir-fry noodles, Salads. As a regular, everything we've tried has never disappointed. Highly recommended.

BTW, for the regular take-out runs, AT&T's 3G service has gotten much better inside. If you want to step out for a few minutes while you wait for your food, you can peruse the aisles the neighboring Blockbuster or GameStop across the way.
author: Albert P.

description: I've only been to the King of Thai at this location about 6 months back.  After getting the recommendation from a Thai friend, I was looking forward to trying this place.  I was hoping for the great food experience I had while traveling in Thailand a couple of years ago.  Unfortunately, my food ended up being quite ordinary.  The place is also quite dirty.  I ended with a very upset stomach (although I didn't have the runs like some yelpers).  Needless to say, I've not been back since.
author: Paul K.

description:
So this is the second King of Thai restaurant I'm familiar with, and like that one, this place is more like a high 3... like a 3.6 or something... well now it is after tonight.

This place is a lot closer to my place than the one on Taraval so it automatically gets a thumbs up in that department. Even though the place is pretty small... smaller than the place on Taraval... I've never had to wait to get a table here. I notice that the walls are some weird purple lavender color... I don't know, I'm colorbind... and yet the waitresses aren't wearing the matching polo shirts that the ones in Taraval do... I don't know if it's a requirement... but it doesn't really matter.

This place, I'm use to two dishes... the  pad thai and the pineapple fried rice. The pineapple fried rice is aesthetically better, but I think you get more with the Taraval. However, I always thought the fried rice was pretty good here... though  I have one complaint. Tonight, the shrimp didn't taste all that great. I can't put my finger on it, but I just didn't like the taste. It's a first, though... unless I'm just now recognizing it. The pad thai is pretty good... but I can't really compare between the two King of Thais since it's been a while since I've been to the Taraval one.

If you're shopping at Lucky's, and you're craving Thai food, this place is pretty good most of the time. It seems cleaner than the one on Taraval even though it's quite tiny and the food for the most part is generally the same.... let me take that back... it might be a little bit better over at Taraval, but I'm just going on memory.
author: Chris S.

description:
I have to agree with most of the other reviewers on KOT.  This place is ok.  You won't be disappointed with the food but don't get your expectations up.  It's fast-food, thai style.  They take your order and push you out the door quickly.  I've been to three KOT's and they're all pretty much the same.  

I'm just curious where they get their waitresses from.  I've never seen more thin thai girls in one place before....sweet.
author: Bruce B.

description:
I don't know how it happens, but I feel that with Thai cuisine, you can barely go wrong.

The dishes here are your typical Thai cuisine, very average. The price is very reasonable, and the portions are good.

The only reason I'm giving it 3 stars is because its ambiance and cleanliness isn't the best, so the place can definitely improve in those areas.
author: Gabe R.

description:
I love this place.  I think it's authentic Thai.  the people don't really speak english if you try to hold a conversation with them.  I think I once asked how long this place opened. The waitress looked confused and quickly grabbed her friend.  

The people are real nice.  I never have to ask for more water or anything. The waiters/waitresses are always moving around...not just standing around like at some other places where you gotta put your hand up to get their attention cause your glass is empty.

I usually order the #16 or the pad thai.  My bf loves the #15.  Occasionally I will order the #17 if I wanna save it for lunch the next day.
author: Leena C.

description:
Ok...after finding out the hard way that my Thai spot #2 has closed down and moved on to the Sloat Boulevard side...I decided that I truly needed my Pad Thai fix of the day.

There weren't any huge lines and the staff is efficient and nice. I absolutely live on the noodle dish that has the Chinese sausage and the seafood variety (shrimp and stuff)...that is a close second to the pad Thai itself.  It's one of the few Pad Thai's in the City that isn't dripping with oil...it has plenty of soy beans too that's fresh...love those nuts...damn...I'm hungry again...

The soup dishes are huge portions itself...sometimes it's really hard to just finish it, so make sure to ask for a container to take it home.

Take out can be from 10-15 minutes, so please take a walk around the shopping area or just stop in Blockbuster's next door then come back laters to pick up your order.
author: Pauline L.

description:
This place is small but the food is good. Also pretty cheap.

Service is slow.

CASH ONLY- not good for me cuz I never have cash on me. I always use a credit card.

Lots of parking.

My kuya brought me here because he told me that he always goes here to get his weekly Thai fix. I always have to try the Pad Thai whenever I go to a new Thai place. I have to say that I really enjoyed it! I can't wait to go back and try something new!
author: Lauren Y.

description: This place is absolutely delicious. From my experience, there's always seating and the spicy chicken with rice and fried egg is absolutely delectable! The male server was very nice. The rest of the crew, however, exuded a sense of not wanting us there. Regardless, the food is delicious and that's all that really matters. I'll definitely want to eat here again.
author: Cesar C.

description: Ok, tonight was the last straw for this place. They have consistently screwed up my order pickup, long waits and handing me the wrong food have led me to going there and ordering in person. Tonight I pulled 3 hairs out of my dinner and my wife said her's was terrible. Too bad as I would like this place to be decent as the other king of Thai restaurants but the service and food are just consistently subpar.
author: hal p.

description:
I have only eaten in the restaurant a couple of times but have enjoyed numerous take out meals. I have to say that it is a cute restaurant. The staff is quiet and the kitchen is on the right hand side when you enter. It is the type of restaurant that you would take your friends that come to visit. It is moderately priced and you can easily share a dish (but it is more fun to get two to share!). 

I have enjoyed every dish from the menu. I love their curries (green and yellow especially). I tried this delicious seafood medley thai noodle dish and I have dreamt about it since. Overall, I recommend King of Thai to everyone who comes over to visit.
author: Melissa B.

description: The service wasn't very friendly. Too bad they don't accept credit cards. The food didn't impress me.
author: Kstalia L.

description: Probably the one with the best parking, cleanliness, and *BEST SPECIAL RIGHT NOW WITH FREE THAI ICE TEA EVERY DAY*. The service, CASH ONLY, is really quick and pretty friendly. All the food is made fresh and is very fragrant and flavorful. Pad Kee Mow and soup (number 5?) is the best are the best IMHO. I love all the different spices and the chili in vinegar sauce.  Love this place for thai at all times of the day (this one isnt open as late as the others on clement and taraval)
author: James T.

description:
i chose this place over all the other king of thai's in the city cause it was closest to my house... sad to say, i chose the WORSE K.O.T. outta all of them.  i usually get the typical thai fried rice that usually taste sooo amazing, i can scarf it down in about lets say 2hours...jk.maybe 20 minutes..but at this place... it was a shame, i could barely even finish half the plate.. 

by the end of the night, i was embarasssed because i took my filipino pals who dont like to try new things here..and their experience with thai food was not good. shame on them. i played the badguy when it came to the bill..

they're service is c to the r to the a to the p. C-R-A-P also. so def, two stars.."meh. i've experienced better."
author: Em C.

description:
Ordered for delivery some pineapple fried rice and some curry with potatoes. plus other things... Pineapple was spoiled, tasted like rotten pineapple. Potatoes were not fully cooked and something was also spoiled. I think that was the pork. One order.. Two spoiled entrees...
That may explain why they were giving 10% off... If the City needs money, I'm sure that they can cash sonme fines with them.
author: Jean-Yves F.

description: Service was very accommodating. Great food, great prices.  Nuff said.
author: simple g.

description: I used to only go to the King of Thai on Clement Street but this one is just as good. I think I always get #32, it's the one with the pounded fried chicken breast on top of fried rice. SO GOOD. Every time my sisters come to visit me they have to stop by this place. The food is cheap and is ready so fast. It is really top notch thai food for cheap.
author: JC C.

description:
The Sloat spot is one of the Cleanest of all the King of Thai's.  

#31 will hit the spot if you're hungry!  Boneless Fried Chicken over Fried Rice!

Plus... Big Portions!  Great stuff!!
author: Samurai J.

description: Not bad at all for Thai food. Got the food fairly quickly and it was pretty good. I did really enjoy all the different sauces that they had to put on your food. If only they would label them so I had some clue as to what I was putting onto my food. I sampled a little of the pumpkin curry, which was nice but I enjoyed my Pad see Ew more (I think that might have been what it was called. It's been some time since I was there).  Pictures of my meal here http://veiwtifuljoe.wordpress.com/2010/11/12/a-break-to-showcase-some-food/
author: Joseph F.

description: I love king of thai...I don't live in the area, but here almost every weekend.. Whenever I come to visit King of Thai is always a must..I love the fried rice with calamari, and their pad thai is pretty good too! Service is rather pretty fast..ordering to go is under a 10 min wait depending I guess on the crowd..the only thing that disappoints me I would have to say is the fact its cash only! boo**
author: karenina c.

description: Out of all the King of Thais this is my favorite. I had a good experience here unlike the others. In the other King of Thais you are normally surrounded by mean servers. In this one you don't get that. Instead you get a quiet environment with servers who are patient. Not one moment did I feel like they were forcing me to hurry up or leave with their body language so it was nice to finally find a good King of Thai that gave good service.
author: Sonlay V.

description: i like their pad thai..their pad kee ma (sp?) is good too. really fast and always use to go here for lunch or dinner between classes at sf state. cash only tho but theres a lucky near by with atm machines and BOA atm inside.
author: Angela C.

description:
I don't expect much as far as service, especially in Asian owned places.  But I agree, receiving the check BEFORE I even ask for it, is quite rude.  Having to chase down someone to get a refill on my glass of water really irritates me.  
The food is pretty good, but the best King of Thai is the definetely the original one.  Only reason I go to this one is it's closer to my house.
author: Mark J.

description: This place was okay, but I prefer the one in the Tenderloin/nob hill area.
author: Ua R.

description: Taraval location was a good experience. The noodle soups are cheap and tasty.
author: Kongkaew T.

description: The food is cheap. But it is also delicious. I love coming to King of Thai for some fried rice or curry. I usually have the regular fried rice and I have never been disappointed. I don't come here enough but when I do it's always worth it. The serving portions are made for 2 meals or one really big meal which makes coming here very much worth it. I cannot find anything wrong with this place or for any or most of their other locations.
author: Alex E.

description: Food is ok, for some reason their sister resturant on Taravel is much better in taste. Different cooks I guess
author: jason c.

description: I love King of Thai! The food is so good, and the staff are so friendly. I have been gong to king of thai for many years and am always happy when I eat there. It is also very hard to find a thai restaurant that has such authentic thai food. I have been to Thailand and the food tastes just like the food I had there. It's also a wonderful place to bring kids and groups. Great restaurant!!!!
author: Kristie S.

description:
at about 3:20pm sitting on my uncomfortable, old, adjustable chair i started to have this desire to have pad thai. i was badly salivating for this simple, common thai dish that i kept drinking cups & cups of water and bothering our pharmacist who was sitting next to me about pad thai and where to go......thinking it will help me to stop yearning for this certain noodle...which unfortunately it DID NOT!!

i even specifically told my eating partner after work that we have to have PAD THAI & nothing else for dinner.

i decided just to drive a short mile from my place and that was why we came to this restaurant.

a quick, attentive lady server in her lavender t-shirt uniform that matches the wall of this place, warmingly welcomed us to be seated at the back part of the dining area...and that was okay.
we were handed a plastic covered menu which we didn't even bother to look, for i know what i already want and he also chose to have trhe same dish as mine.

i can hear the sizzling, frying & stirring of our food being cooked.
this time, the inside of my mouth was foaming like a crazy dog so ready to devour its prey, which in this case it was a pad thai that i'm quick to kill!!!!

it came to our table steaming hot & generously portioned. the flavor of fish sauce and tamarind paste was nicely combined together. only three pieces of small shrimps was all they put, cube, fried tiny tofus, few slices of green onions, meager ground peanuts was sprinkled and tons of bean sprouts (which i did not like , by the way) were all thrown in the mix.

this ordinary and gratifying meal was quickly eaten and my craving was fixed!!!!

i'll be back here again for my next episode of some insane "fire in th belly."
author: Nelle A.

description:
it's okay. If you you're a fan of noodle soup from the other king of Thai noodle restaurants - don't go to this one. My wife was craving beef noodle soup and she loves king of thai in Union Square so we tried this place. The noodles here were really bland and we'll never go back.
It was obvious that something was wrong when we finished all our other dishes but the noodle soup was completely full. When our waitress came by i told her (my wife was too greng jai) that the soup was not as good as the other king of thai noodle restaurants. We were very polite and expected that she'd comp the soup or apologize. Instead, she told us that they don't use MSG like all the other king of thai noodle houses and that's why the soup tastes different. But the noodles sucked, honestly, and they should have been free. And if there's any doubt of our credibility, i lived in thailand for 7 years, i've worked in a thai restaurant (as a cook) and my wife is, as you would have guessed by now, thai herself. 

King of Thai Noodle on Sloat - you gave us bad noodles! And we plan to take our Noodle hunger elsewhere. You should have just said sorry, and is there something else we can get you and i would have been happy. But you decided to sucker punch your parent (not sister) restaurant in Union Square to defend your crappy noodles. So fork you and good luck with your noodles.
author: Brendan K.

description: This is fast and easy thai food.  They have the basics, nothing super fancy.  I've never had to wait for a table there and the food is always consistent.  The food is very home-cooking like, and the portions are decent.  Overall.. good place to get your thai food craving without breaking the bank.
author: Alan N.

description: They serve Thai food here like well-trained Ninja's. Yesterday we got 3 entrees delivered to our table in less than 5 minutes ... our appetizer actually took the longest (perfectly fried vegetarian rolls). I had flat noodles with beans, peppers, & pork. It was very tasty and more than I could eat so I also reheated it this morning around 1030. I also had a Thai Iced Tea. Perfect.
author: Todd F.

description: Yummy Thai food, fast service and awesome Thai ice tea! The great thing is you get a free Thai ice tea if you dine in with an order of a appetizer or an entree. I always order the Tom Kha Kai soup and the duck entree. Very yummy! It's a good restaurant to be for a quick and simple dining. I just found that they have delivery service too. Will give it a try next time!
author: Jackie W.

description: My boyfriend took me to this place for lunch.  They do have many branch but this one is taste better.  I tried the one on clement street but still a little different than this store.  The noodle in right taste.  The soup is excellent.  If I go back to SF I will visit again :)
author: SALLY C.

description: I ordered soup with chow fun, meatballs and minced meat a while back.  It was really good soup, basic though, probably salt, msg, with the broth of some type of meat, however, I enjoyed it.  It was very heartwarming, especially eating it soaking wet after a cold tuesday dragonboat practice in lake merced.  The prices you pay for the portions you give is an A+.  The Pad Thai and Pad See Ew seem very tempting to get, as well.  I believe I saw that they charge you for hot tea?  I'm not exactly sure though.
author: Morris C.

description:
King of Thai Noodles. Another one of my favorites. Comfort food. I always order the number 17 with vegetables and tofu. We frequent the place so often that the waitress knows what we want before I even say it. 
Number 17 consists of flat rice noodles, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, basil, fried tofu(but you can get it with beef, chicken or seafood) and something hot and spicy. I LOVE it. I've been to all the King of Thai Noodles locations in the city, but frequent the one on Sloat Blvd the most. The service is good, they are fast, cheap and they always have Thai karaoke videos playing on the tv. 
We've also ordered curries there and soup. They are all consistently good. The curries can get spicy though, so be careful when ordering. We've also ordered dessert there, sticky rice with mango. It's decent. But there is a reason why they are called King of Thai Noodles. It's because noodles are what they do best.
author: Caroline C.

description: I'm so sad! The last couple of times I've been here have been bad: the pad thai was super dry, my yellow curry had pineapples in it instead of potatoes and the customer service has been blah. I'm very dissapointed..I will probably only go here as a last resort now.
author: Annie N.

description: When I first started going to king of thai they had free soda refills.   A few y ears later they decided to stop offering these free refills.  After that I decided not to buy any drinks from this establishment because of the low quality fountain drinks.   One day I asked if I could bring my own drinks because they only had fountain drinks.  They said yes.  For the last 5 years I have been bringing my own drinks until today, the cook in the back seemed to signal the waitress telling us not to bring drinks anymore.  Not only that, they decided to charge us 15 percent tip.  From what I remember, we had 6 people, have had that many before and never got a forced 15 percent tip.  I bring 6 to 8 guys with me to lunch almost every day and if your reading this.  I will not be bringing those guys to your restaurant anymore.  Thank you and goodbye.
author: Bjj P.

description: Eh. Its King of Thai. They're all usually the same right? I recall this location being cleaner looking than the others though.
author: Elaine H.

description: Good tai food at below borderline pricey food. Dishes typically range from $7.95 -$10 a plate.  I would buy lunch here back when my work was near by. Stopped going because of the price increase.  I guess since I make more now it doesnt seem that expensive anymore. 3 stars for being good overall.
author: Keit K.

description: Good place to get Thai for a decent price. The fried rice and yellow curry is good as well.
author: Raymond S.

description: I have ordered from King of Thai pretty frequently, but the last few times have been better than today.  Today, we ordered about 8 meals to go -- three of which were my favorite:  pad see ew.  Only problem is that they seem to have cooked them all together and divided them.  Two problems with that:  they must have guessed portionsize incorrectly and put in two portion sizes and divided it up three ways PLUS they didn't divide evenly so that my dinner didn't have ANY veggies but another one of them had almost all of the veggies.  We only had one order of each other meals, and I noticed that those sizes were fine.
author: Patty W.

description: I eat hear frequently with friends from work. Great Thai food and fast friendly service
author: Karen J.

description: This is my favorite king of thai, i've tried several around the city but this one is always good. I love the fast service, the food is always a lot so it serves me for my lunch and I still take some to go for my "dinner" :) Pad see lew plate is my favorite, and there is a papaya salad that is really good too. I've tasted a couple of other things and they've all been great too! Definitely a good place to go.
author: Vanessa P.

description: mmmmmMm!! i like their pad see ew here. very tasty.. uhm their service is okay could be more persistent with refilling and check up on us.
author: Valerie N.

description: Perfect for when you want Thai food and fast! The bf and I have a few favorites: spicy eggplant w/ basil and chicken, fried chicken w/ rice, and won ton w/ noodles. YUM.
author: Mar M.

description:
Oh College Days...

So we used to make a pit stop here for our "Thai Fix" before a night of shots, jungle juice and sexual debauchery... Knowing damn well... we'll be seeing the food again at the end of the night we loved the cheap prices and satisfying taste. We always used to get the Pad Thai and the fried chicken w/ fried rice... the sauce was FRESH with the chicken joint...

The people who worked there were cool and cute in their own fobby way...

Best part? This King of Thai is the ONLY one where parking is EASY to find... YAYUUUUHHH
author: Lena L.

description: Definitely unlike the other King Of Thai. Sorry to say but it is like a knocked-off version of KOT. I feel bad for people who experienced the bitter pad thai, tasteless thai fried rice, bland rad na, and dull pad see ew. Go to other KOT branches and you will find the authentic one. And for KOT-Sloat, evaluate and improve your food pleaseee...
author: Jazzleen H.

description:
a haiku:
i eat thai fried rice
health inspector score card says:
a seventy-nine

or it was some number that was too low for my mental sanity.
author: Sammy G.

description: Sometimes the food is good and sometimes ok, depends on the chef's mood, not the best service either
author: Belinda w.

description: i like this one better than the location on taraval. service has always been nicer and more efficient, and they have the green curry paste fried rice that i dream about sometimes. i've never had a bad dish here, and it doesn't put a huge dent in my wallet.
author: Angela L.

description:
fast, reasonably priced. 
couldn't go wrong with the pad thai (noodles had a good chewy texture) or pineapple fried rice (cashews and chicken!).
author: Albert V V.

description: Spent $21.10 on their food today - would not go back. Chicken soup - too bland, spring rolls - only mediocre. 3rd dish - just OK...very greasy/oily.  Would not recommend.
author: elaine w.

description: I read some reviews about the Phad-Thai not being good (mildly put) and I agree.  I'll pass on that the next time.  This place is what it is.  Fairly priced hot food conveniently located.  It's a bit hard to understand that the quality of food per location varies, but like I suggested earlier it's good enough.  You want better Thai, go to Marni, Ploy, Sai Jai, but if you want to stay in this part of town this place is ok.
author: Paul J G.

description: My friends and I come here all the time. The service is always friendly and the food is awesome! Everything is always cooked on the spot so you know you're getting it hot and fresh. And I wouldn't get a Thai ice tea anywhere else!
author: Joshua C.

description: Great location--perfect for take out and a rental.  My go to options are always the pad thai and the pad kee mao.  I highly recommend them both.  The service is quick, the food's pretty cheap and tastes great.
author: Tony L.

description:
we went there for lunch yesterday and the place is much cleaner and more western design than the ones in taraval and clements.  i usually order the beef noodle soup and chicken curry.  sometimes i order fry rice or pad thai but they are all good.  the noodle soup seems to be getting sweeter and sweeter so i am not liking it anymore.  

please don't make ur soup broth too sweet.
author: donald c.

description: Here or Taraval St. works for me. King of Thai is good for a quick eat. My suggestion is their larb or any of their noodle dishes. Parking lot is a bit tight, especially on weekends.
author: Leroid D.

description: The dishes here are pretty savory and delicious, however, the noodle soups aren't that good . They're mostly bland . The stir fried noodles are good too, like the Rad Nar and the Pad See Lew . YUMMY !
author: Jenny Y.

description: cheap, fresh food prepared within minutes of order. I wish it were open as late as their taraval location, but i guess people need sleep too. everything stir-fried seems to taste just a little bit better in this location than taraval, not to mention the people are just a little more friendly. despite the nicer staff, and cleaner tables (and vomit-friendly lavendar decor), this place is much more suited for takeout, for an unexplained reason. takeout you get here. for a sit-down experience, go to the one on taravel or clement.
author: Ben T.

description: This place is a chain and has many other restaraunts throughout the city. Anyways I've tried a few of the noodle dishes here such as the Pad-Sew with chicken, the rahd na (again with chicken =) !), the fried chicken breast over rice with egg, and the chicken satay skewers. I did enjoy the Pad-Sew although it was a bit greasy. The skewers were terrible, unfortunately they were super dry and really had no flavor. The rahd na also did not have much a flavor either. If I'm in the area, I may go back here to try a new dish but I'd much rather prefer to go to authentic places like Chabaa to get my thai food. This place is good though if you're in a rush and need something quick to eat.
author: Miss H K.

description: Few years back, the KOT on taraval would be getting the five stars. But lately they are just...i dont know. But on with the sloat location! This is officially the best KOT i know in the city. I don't get anything else in there but the "Duck fried rice" it's a guilty pleasure. It's just way too good. it's quite oily though, maybe that's why its so good. Parking is a breeze, but the actual spot where KOT is at, sometimes can be a squeeze. But nothing is stopping you parking a bit further away right?
author: Terry S.

description: order the flat noodle in sweet soy sauce with tofu for a take out order. It was a surprisingly huge portion. Went for about $8.70 after tax. Would order that plate again in a heartbeat. Never liked anything else on their menu.
author: Robin L.

description: This location is one of the better King of Thai except of course the regional. Flavors and portions are always great to perfection. Service here isn't so great at times, but it's expected when your server is asian and trust me there are much worser out there. It's perfect for on the go because while your food is being prepared, you can go rent a movie at blockbuster next door or grab a bag of chips at lucky supermarket.
author: David M.

description:
This review goes for all King of Thai restaurants because there's no difference between any of them.

This is where I go for a quick eat.  You can't go wrong with pad thai, pad see ewe or pad kee mao here.  If i'm hungry and it's late, then I just do a quick take-out.  The service is fast and the food is good.  It's also pretty cheap too.  

This is my option over fast food anyday.
author: Scott L.

description: For quick thai food, this is where I'd go.  The service isn't great but they are fast.  The food is good, not great.  Decent prices.  Lots of people get take-out here.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Had the yellow curry with pork. Service was good, and the food came quickly. You get the most bang for your buck, as the portions are generous. Every time I come here I have to get the thai iced tea. Nothing special about the drink here, I just love it.

Located in a plaza with lots of parking spaces, this restaurant is a convenient choice for those craving Thai. I only wish there were more plazas in SF like there are in Irvine where I used to live.

The only negative I can think of is they accept only cash.
author: Jason T.

description: If you are looking for a great thai food - you definitely have to come to this one! Its reasonably price, portions are big and the food is always yummy!
author: Joiera C.

description: When I lived in San Francisco, this was my favorite thai eatery because of the quickness of everything. I still have my three favorites: Chicken Pad See Yew, Chicken Satay, and the chicken with peanut sauce over rice; Simple but satisfied my ever taste buds.
author: Cindy W.

description:
I come here for my Thai Iced Tea and Pad Kee Mao fix. 2 stars for that.
Service can definitely be a little rude, especially when I'm on my way home and just want a Thai Iced Tea. They look at me as if to say, "That's It?" Guess like it's no tips for you!
I do feel bad though cause one time my friend and I ate here and only had not nearly enough for tips to pay them in cash. And we definitely didn't want to pull out the card! So okay. here's the extra star.
author: Diana W.

description:
this place is small, but the service is quick.  especially with call in orders, they'll usually have it ready within 10 mins.  that's fast.

i usually get the duck fried rice, which is one of my favorite dishes.  CASH only which sucks since i'm one of those people who doesn't like to carry much cash on them.
author: Caroline E.

description: I give King of Thai 3.5 stars. ts a great place to go if youre in a hurry to get somewhere and need to pick up food. I can usually get in and out of the place in about 10 minutes. Its pretty decent, but sometimes the pad thai is bland and dry, I guess it depends on the cook working at the time. I hate that its a chain, but its convenient, cheap and decent.
author: Katrina C.

description: #21 - Basil , green bell pepper, ground chicken , add a fried egg , put that over rice! One of my favorites here. It's as good as the one's in BKK  T-Land.
author: Daniel W.

description: I often eat here if going to see a movie at the Daly City 20.  No wait, super fast service, cheap, and soups/curries/pad thai that are really good.  Sure, I have had better, but not for anything approaching the price.
author: Alured P.

description: I went here on a lazy Saturday afternoon, after having done nothing but playing too much  PC games for my own good. To set me free from my addiction, my girlfriend decided to drag me to King of Thai Noodles for dinner. She endulged herself in the yellow-something-something curry, whilst I went for the red curry which consequently burned my mouth and my intestines. I really enjoyed that, after having been congested for a day or two. Seriously though, it's a great place for fresh Thai food, the waiters are very friendly and it's in a nice neighborhood. I enjoy their selection and that the food is served warm and fresh. I haven't tried their noodles yet, but I will one of these days. Preferably on a Saturday evening, after having spent too much time playing PC Games.
author: Roger W.

description: I've been to various KOTs. I frequent this one the most because they have easy parking. The food here is probably not the best out of all the KOTs but it is good enough for me due to the parking. Besides, its in a great neighborhood in SF. The fried noodle dishes and soup noodles are all recommendable, and even the rice dishes are good, but I wouldnt recommend the curries.
author: Norton W.

description: Love this place! Parking is easy and the food is super fast. The pad thai is a little too sweet though, but that's my only problem. Soups are flavorful! My favorite is the duck fried rice. My husband is Thai and said that the pad see ew is spot on.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Love their food!! I was just sorry the one on 32nd closed!!
author: Kara E.

description:
Pros: good price; fast service; good variety of Thai cafe food

Cons: cash only; dishes can be hit or miss; always seem to be out of crab for their crab fried rice when we go
author: Tiffany T.

description: King of Thai food in my book.  Good food, fast service, and inexpensive.
author: Brent C.

description:
hmmm..

this place offers different promotion on different days. for example, friday-sunday there is a free thai ice tea for those who want to dine-in. i thought that was kind of interesting because I love thai ice tea but i still decided to take it out.

so, we ordered roasted duck over rice with thai sauce, beef garlic over rice(no.36), white onion thai chili beef over rice (no.35) and boneless fried chicken over fried rice.

the roast duck over rice is okay because it taste kind of sweet. we thought that the beef over rice dishes were nice but the meat isn't tender enough. for the boneless fried chicken over rice, we thought it is okay.

but i keep on coming back here because i find this place is a better place than the thai restaurant near my house plus there are a lot of stores around it. while waiting, I could even go to lucky or game stop across the store.
author: Finu L.

description: i love this place because of their pad thai... hella eggs and hella nuts... and thats how i like it
author: bella h.

description: I used to order Tom Yum Gai to go, but I won't anymore since I found out they changed their to-go soup containers to plastic.  I ordered soup to-go yesterday and when I got home I had to throw it out because the smell of plastic was too disgusting.  Not only that, but the chemicals broken down by the heat are pretty carcinogenic.  I've noticed that a lot of Asian restaurants use plastic containers not designed for holding hot foods as their to-go containers.  Unless you want to get cancer, especially reproductive cancers, don't eat anything (hot)  that's been sitting in those plastic containers.
author: Jenny L.

description: ordered the pad thai (i always order this at thai restaurants) One of my cousin order #8 with fat noodles and a Thai Ice tea, i don't remember what my other cousin ordered, and i don't remember what my cousin's BF ordered but the pad thai was decent. one bad thing is that my cousin said she saw the waitresses adding water to the Thai Ice tea just so they can use less tea and milk. i was like WTF..but anyways.. other then that, the food was good..
author: Patrick T.

description: King of Thai I love you!  Good prices and GREAT food. The yellow curry is excellent! And the staff is always really nice.  I had to take a star off for not accepting credit cards...but you can always run to Albertsons if you need some quick cash and have a check card:)
author: Marie M.

description: very rude. the waitress got my order wrong and refused to take it back. food is decent but i would never go back due to the lack of service.
author: Elbert U.

description: This is the first King of Thai I've been to. Loved it since they are cheap, fast, and delicious. Try it out!
author: Rachel P.

description: i only eat here because its close to school. sometimes i crave pad thai, you know? i ate here once with my friend, and ive decided that it is better to order pad thai take-out. just a little advice.
author: Judy L.

description: Hahaha, this King of Thai has parking (that is no laughing matter, for sure- try going to the Clement location).  I swear, one time I used my stopwatch- they made me and my friend's order in about 3 minutes.  Sure, we were the only new table in there, but that is FAST.  These days I always order #16 and Clement and Sloat have been pretty consistent.  I wouldn't say it's the most authentic Thai, but it is between fast food thai and 'sitdown' thai.  Whatever the classification, it is my favorite Thai restaurant and for sure the one I go most to.  Unfortunately, they are cash only, which has some negative 'hole in the wall' vibe (especially after I did my taxes).  Most all of the KOT have these chatty Thai waitresses- I wish I knew Thai so I could hear what they are talking about- they chat up a good storm and seem to be having a good time.  Ahhhh, their food hits the spot when I just need some of that tasty asian food!
author: Mouse P.
